translated: The phrase that uninterrupted mind indicates the causal sign of the meditative object of calm abiding.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa zhi gnas kyi sems de'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgod pa nye bar zhi ba'i gnas ni zhi gnas yin la /üîΩde'i rgyu mtshan ni yid la byed pa de yin pas na zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes ston to /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa zhi gnas kyi sems de'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgod pa nye bar zhi ba'i gnas ni zhi gnas yin la / de'i rgyu mtshan ni yid la byed pa de yin pas na zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes ston to /
translated: That attention of the mind of serenity which has as its object the nondiscursive image is called the reason for serenity.üîΩThis shows that serenity is the basis for the pacification of restlessness, and that attention is the reason for that.

original: sems bying ngam bying du dogs pan zhes bya bas ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus bstan te /
analyzed: sems bying ngam bying du dogs pan zhes bya bas ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus bstan te /
translated: When the mind is lax or threatened with laxity, one should cultivate the image of brightness.

original: dus der rab tu 'dzin pa lhag par bsgom dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus der rab tu 'dzin pa lhag par bsgom dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows the time for intensification, because at that time one must cultivate intensification in excess.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sems bying ba gzengs bstod cing dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sems bying ba gzengs bstod cing dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa ste /
translated: Intensification is the stimulation of a lax mind and the focusing of it on the object.

original: lhag mthong gi cha yin no //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi cha yin no //
translated: It is a part of insight.

original: de la sems bying ngam zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis sems nyams par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems bying ngam zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis sems nyams par byas pa'o //
translated: Here, the mind is lax when it is impaired by lethargy and sleepiness.

original: bying du dogs pa na zhes bya ba ni bying ba'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: bying du dogs pa na zhes bya ba ni bying ba'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa na'o //
translated: When he fears sinking, means when he is about to become conducive to sinking.

original: mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams zhes bya bas ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi'i rgyu mtshan bstan te /
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams zhes bya bas ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi'i rgyu mtshan bstan te /
translated: The signs of the basis of full attention are indicated by the words: the things that are conducive to joy.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi rnam pa dag go //
translated: The aspects of cessation and path are the basis of full attention.üîΩAfter full attention to the mind has been cultivated, he applies himself to the sign of serenity in order to purify the path of full attention.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i sems yongs su bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu rab tu 'dzin pa'i lam yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma nyid la sbyor ba yang rab tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i sems yongs su bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu rab tu 'dzin pa'i lam yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma nyid la sbyor ba yang rab tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The latter is the sign of the basis of full attention.

original: de yang snga mas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog la /
analyzed: de yang snga mas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog la /
translated: Moreover, the former is the counteragent to the adverse elements,

original: phyi mas ni gnyen po'i rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: phyi mas ni gnyen po'i rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: while the latter is the counteragent that follows after.

original: skabs 'dir ni snga ma nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni snga ma nyid gzung ngo //
translated: In this context, however, the former is to be accepted.

original: sems kyi mtshan ma de zhes bya bas ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan te /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan ma de zhes bya bas ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan te /
translated: The sign of the mind is indicated by the words: the sign of the mind.

original: lhag mthong gi dmigs pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan de'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi dmigs pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan de'o //
translated: That is the conceptual image that is the object of insight.üîΩThat attention is called the sign of full attention.

original: yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni sems bying ba gzengs bstod cing dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa ni rab tu 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni sems bying ba gzengs bstod cing dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa ni rab tu 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: This shows that full attention is the uplifting of a lax mind and the focusing on the object.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ni yid la byed pa de yin pas na rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ni yid la byed pa de yin pas na rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The sign of that is that attention, and so it is called the sign of full attention.

original: zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am /üîΩlhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am /
analyzed: zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am / lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am /
translated: Whether it is the path of serenity,üîΩthe path of insight,üîΩor the path that is the union of the two.

original: zung du 'brel pa'i lam yang rung ste zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms kyi dus bstan te /üîΩdus de gsum du btang snyoms lhag par bsgom @176a * //
analyzed: zung du 'brel pa'i lam yang rung ste zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms kyi dus bstan te / dus de gsum du btang snyoms lhag par bsgom @176a * //
translated: This shows the time for equanimity.

original: dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is necessary to cultivate equanimity especially during those three times.

original: de gnyis ka nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa la zhes bya bas btang snyoms kyi gzhi'i rgyu mtshan bstan te /
analyzed: de gnyis ka nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa la zhes bya bas btang snyoms kyi gzhi'i rgyu mtshan bstan te /
translated: Both of these are the basis of equanimity, since they are not afflicted by the secondary afflictions.

original: zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'i lam la ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med la /
analyzed: zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'i lam la ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med la /
translated: On the path that is definite as just serenity, there is no secondary affliction of agitation or regret.

original: lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'i lam la ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med /
analyzed: lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'i lam la ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med /
translated: On the path that is definite as just insight, there is no secondary affliction of lethargy or sleep.

original: thung du 'brel pa'i lam la ni de gnyi ga'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thung du 'brel pa'i lam la ni de gnyi ga'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: On the path that is a combination of the two, there is no secondary affliction of both.

original: btang snyoms kyi sems de nyid ces shin tu gong nas gong du yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa de nyid la ran par dpyod cing brtson 'grus ha cang lhag par rtsom par mi byed pa yang btang snyoms kyi gzhi'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi sems de nyid ces shin tu gong nas gong du yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa de nyid la ran par dpyod cing brtson 'grus ha cang lhag par rtsom par mi byed pa yang btang snyoms kyi gzhi'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: That very equanimity is the basis of equanimity, since it is the proper analysis and effort of the mind that is equanimous on that very object in order to purify it more and more, and it is the nonexcessive exertion of effort.

original: de yang snga mas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog la /
analyzed: de yang snga mas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog la /
translated: The former is the antidote to the opposing factors.

original: phyi mas ni gnyen po'i rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: phyi mas ni gnyen po'i rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: The latter is the engagement of the antidote.

original: skabs 'dir ni snga ma nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni snga ma nyid gzung ngo //
translated: But here the former is to be accepted.

original: sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa na zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan te /
analyzed: sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa na zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen the mind is engaged by its intrinsic nature‚Äù indicates the objective mental image of equanimity.

original: zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i gnas skyabs so //
analyzed: zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa dngos po'i mtha' dang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i gnas skyabs so //
translated: The objective mental image of the path of unification is the limit of existence, and the ultimate purpose is the stage of the refuge.

original: yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa ni btang snyoms yin la /üîΩde'i rgyu mtshan ni gnas skabs de dag ni yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa de yin pas na btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa ni btang snyoms yin la /üîΩde'i rgyu mtshan ni gnas skabs de dag ni yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa de yin pas na btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe spontaneous mental attention is called the objective mental image of equanimity‚Äù indicates that equanimity is the spontaneous mental attention.üîΩThe objective mental image of equanimity is the stage of spontaneous mental attention.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe spontaneous mental attention is called the objective mental image of equanimity‚Äù indicates that equanimity is the spontaneous mental attention.üîΩThe objective mental image of equanimity is the stage of spontaneous mental attention.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i rgyu mtshan yongs su shes pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas bsgom sa'i rgyu mtshan yongs
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i rgyu mtshan yongs su shes pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas bsgom sa'i rgyu mtshan yongs
translated: The treatise that teaches the ascertainment of designations is taught in order to prevent the degeneration of the path of serenity and insight that is fully distinguished by thorough knowledge of the reasons for meditating in that way and to prevent its destruction.

original: su shes pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni bsgom pa'i rgyu mtshan yongs su shes pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa yin no /
analyzed: su shes pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni bsgom pa'i rgyu mtshan yongs su shes pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa yin no /
translated: The ascertainment of designations is taught in order to prevent the destruction of thorough knowledge of the reasons for meditation.

original: // / de'i 'og tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par bshig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par bshig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad bar bya ste /
translated: After that, in order to destroy manifest pride and prevent destruction, the meaning of the words of the ascertainment of designations and so on will be explained.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na zhi gnas tsam dang shes pa dang / mthong ba dan don tsam skyes pa la brten nas yongs su ma shes pa dang /üîΩmngon sum du ma byas pa'i chos dang don gzhan @176b dag kyang yongs su shis shing mngon sum du byas so snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na zhi gnas tsam dang shes pa dang / mthong ba dan don tsam skyes pa la brten nas yongs su ma shes pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa'i chos dang don gzhan @176b dag kyang yongs su shis shing mngon sum du byas so snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'o //
translated: The so-called manifest pride is the pride that arises when one is engaged in the path of serenity and insight, and one thinks, I have understood and realized all the other phenomena and meanings that I have not understood and realized, on the basis of the mere arising of serenity, knowledge, and insight.

original: rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal de rnam par gzhig cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid
analyzed: rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal de rnam par gzhig cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid
translated: The so-called ascertainment of designation is the path of serenity and insight that is distinguished by the absence of manifest pride, because it destroys manifest pride and prevents its recurrence.

original: de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: and in order to prevent their degeneration and loss, the unerring presentation and explanation of the unerring nature of the path of serenity and insight that is included in yoga is the unerring designation of the unerring nature of the path of serenity and insight that is included in yoga.

original: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?üîΩHere, the noble Maitreya, considering the thoughts of others who think thus:

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor ba rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bas ni bdag nyid chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa la mngon pa'i ngaüîΩrgyal med par bya dgos na /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor ba rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bas ni bdag nyid chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par bya dgos na /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who is engaged in the essence of the path of serenity and insight that is included in yoga should be without unerring pride in the knowledge of phenomena and their significance.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag bar rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ni ji lta bu yin de dag ji ltar na so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag bar rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ni ji lta bu yin de dag ji ltar na so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /
translated: What is the nature of the knowledge of phenomena and the knowledge of their significance? How are they individually distinct? How do they become knowledge?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus par sbyar ro //
translated: The Blessed One, when bodhisattvas cultivate serenity and insight, they have the analytical knowledges of phenomena and meaning.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba yang bstan /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba yang bstan /
translated: Here the Blessed One taught the essence and divisions of the analytical knowledges of phenomena and meaning.

original: de dag byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa yang bstan te /
analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa yang bstan te /
translated: He also taught how bodhisattvas have the analytical knowledges.

original: de yang chos ni gnas yin la don ni gnas pa yin pas gnas kyis gnas pa mtshon dgos pa'i phyir dang po chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba yang bstan /
analyzed: de yang chos ni gnas yin la don ni gnas pa yin pas gnas kyis gnas pa mtshon dgos pa'i phyir dang po chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba yang bstan /
translated: Since phenomena are the basis and meaning is what is based on them, the basis must be indicated by the based. Therefore, first the essence and divisions of the analytical knowledge of phenomena are taught.

original: de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig par bstan to //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig par bstan to //

analyzed: de nyid kyi chos sos yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang bstan te // ming gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bshad pas de bstan te /

analyzed: de nyid kyis so so yang dag par rig @177a * //

original: pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang bstan to //
analyzed: pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang bstan to //

analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bstan to //

analyzed: de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te bshad pa'i chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos so //
translated: The five kinds of love are the essence of the knowledge through teaching.üîΩThe

original: bshad pa'i chos ni rtogs pa'i chos kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir de bstan pas rtogs pa'i chos ma bstan kyang zhar la rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos ni rtogs pa'i chos kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir de bstan pas rtogs pa'i chos ma bstan kyang zhar la rig par bya ste /
translated: The Dharma of the teaching is the root of the Dharma of realization, and therefore, by teaching the former, the latter is also known by implication, even though it is not taught.

original: ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ni brten par bya ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs par btags pa'o // tshig gang zhe na kun nas nyon mongs pa pa dang rnam par byang ba pa'i don rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gnas dang rten ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs la brten pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs gnas dang

translated: The syllables ‚Äúa,‚Äù ‚ÄúƒÅ,‚Äù ‚Äúi,‚Äù ‚Äúƒ´,‚Äù etc., are called ‚Äúsyllables.‚ÄùüîΩFrom each of those, respectively.

translated: By that alone, the nature of the analytical knowledge of the teaching is also shown.üîΩMaitreya, the bodhisattva's analytical knowledge of phenomena is the knowledge of the characteristics of all phenomena.üîΩMaitreya, the bodhisattva's analytical knowledge of etymology is the knowledge of the various languages of sentient beings.üîΩMaitreya, the bodhisattva's analytical knowledge of prowess is the knowledge of the various kinds of eloquence.

analyzed: gzung ba'i don gang zhe na /

original: gnas kyi don dang longs spyod kyi don te /
analyzed: gnas kyi don dang longs spyod kyi don te /

analyzed: de dag gis ni shes bya'i dngos po'i ji snyed yod pa nyid bstan to //
translated: By those, the reality of things that are known as many as they are is taught.

analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don la sogs pa de dag nyid la phyin ci log gi don sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of defilement is the meaning of those very things such as grasping that are preceded by a mistaken meaning.

original: de dag nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'i don sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par byang ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dag nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'i don sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par byang ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of purification is the meaning of those very things such as grasping that are preceded by an unmistaken meaning.

original: de dag gis ni shes bya'i dngos po'i ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni shes bya'i dngos po'i ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid bstan te /
translated: By these, the existence of things that are objects of knowledge just as they are is taught.

original: de ni bstan pa dang don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni bstan pa dang don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the correct knowledge of teaching and meaning.

original: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Classification is a synonym for enumeration.

original: phung po rnams kyi ni grangs lngas so zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ni zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi ni grangs lngas so zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ni zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The aggregates are by means of the enumeration of five. The aggregates are by means of the classification of five aspects.

original: des ni ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: This teaches their nature.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi ni grangs drug gis so zhes bya ba yang rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi ni grangs drug gis so zhes bya ba yang rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The internal sense bases are by means of the enumeration of six. The internal sense bases are by means of the classification of six aspects.

original: des ni zab pa ma bstan to //
analyzed: des ni zab pa ma bstan to //
translated: This does not teach the profound.

original: phyi @178b rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi yang grangs drug kho nas so zhes bya ba yang rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: phyi @178b rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi yang grangs drug kho nas so zhes bya ba yang rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The external sense-spheres are also only six in number. This is the classification of the aspects.

original: des ni longs spyod bstan to //
analyzed: des ni longs spyod bstan to //
translated: This teaches the enjoyment.

original: sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgras ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba gzhan yang bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgras ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba gzhan yang bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that other classifications of the aspects of all the dharmas of defilement and purification are also taught.

original: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: That which is thusness is the characteristic.

original: 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i rgyun gyis 'khor bar 'byung ba ni rnam pa de dag gis gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i rgyun gyis 'khor bar 'byung ba ni rnam pa de dag gis gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The thusness of arising is the thusness of the arising of samsara through the continuity of defilement, action, and birth. It is called thusness because it arises in that way, not otherwise.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi thog ma dang / tha ma med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi thog ma dang / tha ma med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the beginninglessness and endlessness of the formations.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid gsum po dag gang zag dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni de dag gis gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid gsum po dag gang zag dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni de dag gis gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The reality of the characteristics is the unreality of the personal entity and the things, in the three characteristics. It is called reality because it is not otherwise than that.

original: chos thams cad kyi gang zag bdag med pa dang chos bdag med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi gang zag bdag med pa dang chos bdag med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of things in all things.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid nas ngo bo nyid des gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid nas ngo bo nyid des gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The reality of representation is the non-dual nature, because it is not otherwise than that nature.

original: 'du byed rnams rnam par rig pa tsam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnam par rig pa tsam gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mere representation of the formative forces.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid dus la sogs par gnas pa ni ngo bo nyid des gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid dus la sogs par gnas pa ni ngo bo nyid des gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The reality of the basis is the nature of suffering, because it is not otherwise than that nature.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the truth of suffering.

original: log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pas skye ba bsgrub pa ni log par bsgrub pa de nyid kyis gzhan du ma yin par de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pas skye ba bsgrub pa ni log par bsgrub pa de nyid kyis gzhan du ma yin par de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The reality of wrong practice is that the production of birth by karma and the afflictions is just that wrong practice, not anything else, and so it is called reality.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the truth of the origin.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa 'gags pas rnam par dag pa ni rnam par dag pa nyid kyis gzhan du ma yin pas de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /

analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa dgus rnam par gzhag ste /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu dang / gnas skabs dang / sgo dang / che ba dang / phyin ci log pa dang / rnam grangs dang / nyes dmigs kyis so //

original: de la ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /

original: chos gang skye ba na /
analyzed: chos gang skye ba na /

original: byed pa yang 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa yang 'jug pa'o //

original: rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'jug pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang / las kyi lam de nyid kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'o //

original: rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhe na /

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis te /

translated: attachment, hatred, delusion, oneself, others, following others, material gain, fear, harm, play, pleasure, and the idea of the teaching.

original: log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'o //
translated: The cause is also wrong view.

original: gnas skabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the state of action?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / byung ba dang / bag chags kyi gnas so //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / byung ba dang / bag chags kyi gnas so //
translated: small, medium, great, arisen, and habitual.

original: sgo gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo gang zhe na /

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i sgo dang / gnod pa byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i sgo'o //

original: che ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: che ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is greatness?

original: rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is sixfold:

analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang / goms pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / gzhi dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gcig tu nges pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel ba'o //

original: phyin ci log gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log gang zhe na /

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: bya ba phyin ci log dang / 'dzin pa phyin ci log dang / dga' ba phyin ci log go //

original: rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang zhe na /

analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / sgom pas bsdus pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa dang / sdom pas bsdus pa yang ma yin la /

analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang ma yin pa dang / sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang /

analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /

analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes @181b nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang /

analyzed: mi slob pa yang ma yin pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom bas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa dang / dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang //
translated: that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing, that which is to be abandoned by the path of meditation, and that which is not to be abandoned; that which is black and has black karmic maturation, that which is white and has white karmic maturation, and that which is black and white and has black and white karmic maturation.

analyzed: dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar gnag dang // gnag pa yang ma yin /
translated: The white has white karmic maturation.üîΩThe mixed has mixed karmic maturation.üîΩ

original: dkar ba yang ma yin la rnam par smin pa yang med de /
analyzed: dkar ba yang ma yin la rnam par smin pa yang med de /
translated: 1. white, with white retribution; 2. black, with black retribution; 3. black, with white retribution; 4. neither black nor white, with neither black nor white retribution.üîΩThe fourth is the action whose retribution is exhausted.

original: las zad par 'gyur ba dang / yon po'i las dang / nye ba'i las dang / snyigs ma'i las dang / gtsang ma'i las dang mthun pa'i las dag go //
analyzed: las zad par 'gyur ba dang / yon po'i las dang / nye ba'i las dang / snyigs ma'i las dang / gtsang ma'i las dang mthun pa'i las dag go //
translated: The action is crooked, or near, or of the nature of the end, or pure, or conforming.

original: nyes dmigs gang zhe na rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gang zhe na rnam pa bdun te /
translated: What is the disadvantage? It is sevenfold:üîΩharm to oneself, harm to others, harm to both; the production of demerit; the production of a bad reputation; the production of remorse;

original: bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gnyis ka la gnod pa dang / tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang /üîΩyid mi bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gnyis ka la gnod pa dang / tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang /üîΩyid mi bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the production of suffering and sorrow born of remorse.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ; las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams su skye ba med do //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ; las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams su skye ba med do //
translated: The ‚Äúaffliction of birth‚Äù is the non-arising of the afflictions and the karma that afflicts the realms.

analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste / rab tu dbye ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / ma nges pa dang / 'jug pas so // de la rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is established by four kinds of distinctions:

original: khams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba dang / rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: khams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba dang / rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: distinction of the realms, distinction of the destinies, distinction of the abodes, distinction of the families, and distinction of the bodies in the world.

original: de la khams gsum gyi rab tu dbye ba ni khams gsum du skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la khams gsum gyi rab tu dbye ba ni khams gsum du skye ba'o //
translated: The distinction of the realms is the arising in the three realms.

original: 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'gro ba lngar skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'gro ba lngar skye ba'o //
translated: The distinction of the destinies is the arising in the five destinies.

original: gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas gzhan sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs kyi khams na gnas gzhan bco brgyad dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na gnas gzhan bzhi ste /üîΩde dag bsdoms na gnas gzhan lnga bcu rtsa brgyad du skye ba'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas gzhan sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs kyi khams na gnas gzhan bco brgyad dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na gnas gzhan bzhi ste / de dag bsdoms na gnas gzhan lnga bcu rtsa brgyad du skye ba'o //
translated: There are thirty-six realms in the desire realm, eighteen in the form realm, and four in the formless realm.

original: rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams @182a * //üîΩna mi rnams la skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams @182a * // na mi rnams la skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The classification of species is as follows:üîΩIn the desire realm, humans have three types of birth:

original: rigs ngan par skye ba dang / rigs btsun par skye ba dang / rigs ngan par yang ma yin rigs btsun par yang ma yin par skye ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: rigs ngan par skye ba dang / rigs btsun par skye ba dang / rigs ngan par yang ma yin rigs btsun par yang ma yin par skye ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: birth in a low class, birth in a high class, and birth in a class that is neither low nor high.

original: lha ma yin du skye ba dang / sa gzhi la brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / nam mkha'i gzhal med khang du brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / gzugs gyi khams na yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /üîΩso so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'du shes dang bcas pa dang / 'du shes med par skye ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi gnas gtsang mar skye ba dang ; gzugs med pa'i khams na yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: lha ma yin du skye ba dang / sa gzhi la brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / nam mkha'i gzhal med khang du brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / gzugs gyi khams na yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'du shes dang bcas pa dang / 'du shes med par skye ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi gnas gtsang mar skye ba dang ; gzugs med pa'i khams na yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three types of birth in the realm of the demigods, three types of birth in the realm of the gods, three types of birth in the realm of the animals, three types of birth in the realm of the hungry ghosts, three types of birth in the realm of the hells, three types of birth in the realm of humans, three types of birth in the realm of the celestials who dwell on the earth, three types of birth in the realm of the celestials who dwell in the celestial abodes in the sky, and three types of birth in the realm of the form gods.üîΩThere are three types of birth in the realm of the gods: birth in the realm of the gods who possess discernment, birth in the realm of the gods who are without discernment, and birth in the realm of the pure abodes of the noble ones.

original: 'du shes tshad med pa rnams kyi nang du skye ba dang / ci yang med par 'du shes pa rnams kyi nang du skye ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'du shes tshad med pa rnams kyi nang du skye ba dang / ci yang med par 'du shes pa rnams kyi nang du skye ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba ste /
translated: There are three types of birth in the formless realm: birth in the realm of the celestials who possess infinite discernment, birth in the realm of the celestials who possess discernment of nothingness, and birth in the realm of the celestials who possess discernment that is neither with nor without discernment.

original: de dag bsdoms na rigs bcu gnyis su skye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag bsdoms na rigs bcu gnyis su skye ba'o //
translated: When these are combined, there are twelve types of birth.

original: 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag na sems can tshad med pa rnams kyi skye ba tshad med pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag na sems can tshad med pa rnams kyi skye ba tshad med pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The classification of bodies in the world should be understood as the immeasurable births of immeasurable sentient beings in the immeasurable world systems of the ten directions.

original: de la sdug bsngal ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni yun ring po nas skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi yan lag dang nying lag bcad pa mang po nyams su myong ba las khrag zag cing 'bab pa dang / der pha ma dang phu nu dang bu sring gi phyir sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni yun ring po nas skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi yan lag dang nying lag bcad pa mang po nyams su myong ba las khrag zag cing 'bab pa dang / der pha ma dang phu nu dang bu sring gi phyir sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: The classification of suffering is the experience of the many amputations of major and minor body parts of those who go and transmigrate for a long time in those births, the blood flowing and dripping from those wounds, and the suffering for the sake of parents, brothers, sisters, and children.

original: gnyen bshes dang / nor dang / longs spyod zad pa mang po nyams su myong ba rnams kyi mchi ma mang po zag cing 'bab pa dang / de dag tu ma'i nu zho 'thungs pa rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chu bas kyang ches mang ngo zhes gsungs pa dang de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen bshes dang / nor dang / longs spyod zad pa mang po nyams su myong ba rnams kyi mchi ma mang po zag cing 'bab pa dang / de dag tu ma'i nu zho 'thungs pa rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chu bas kyang ches mang ngo zhes gsungs pa dang de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The classification of birth suffering should be understood as being like that.

original: de la ma nges pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi pha dang ma'i mthar thug pa med pa dang / pha ma dang / phu nu dang bu sring dang mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang /
analyzed: de la ma nges pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi pha dang ma'i mthar thug pa med pa dang / pha ma dang / phu nu dang bu sring dang mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang /
translated: The classification of the indefinite is that those who go to and wander in those births have no end of fathers and mothers, and of fathers, mothers, brothers, sisters, preceptors, teachers,

original: bla ma lta bur ma gyur pa med pa dang / gang zag gcig gi bskal pa gcig gi rus pa'i phung po yang gal te sdud pa cig yod pa bsdus nas kyang 'jig pa dang rul bar mi 'gyur du zin na ri bo ngos yangs tsam mo zhes gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: bla ma lta bur ma gyur pa med pa dang / gang zag gcig gi bskal pa gcig gi rus pa'i phung po yang gal te sdud pa cig yod pa bsdus nas kyang 'jig pa dang rul bar mi 'gyur du zin na ri bo ngos yangs tsam mo zhes gsungs pa dang /
translated: There is no one who has not been a mother to you, and if the heaps of bones of one person over the course of one eon were collected and not lost, they would be as large as Mount Meru.

original: de lta bu dang @182b mthun pa rnams ni skye ba'i ma nges pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang @182b mthun pa rnams ni skye ba'i ma nges pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These and similar statements should be understood as the different kinds of uncertainty about birth.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / don dang rab tu dbye ba dang / go rims dang bsdu ba dang / rten rnam par gzhag pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / don dang rab tu dbye ba dang / go rims dang bsdu ba dang / rten rnam par gzhag pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The different kinds of engagement should be understood as the essence of dependent origination, the meaning, the different kinds, the order, the summary, and the establishment of the basis, in those births and in the cycle of existence.

original: rnam par byang ba'i don ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i don la sogs pa de dag nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'i don sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i don ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i don la sogs pa de dag nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'i don sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of purification is the meaning of non-error that precedes those very meanings of grasping, etc.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩbyams pa rnam pa bcu po de dag gis don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni shes bya'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pas mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o // byams pa rnam pa bcu po de dag gis don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni shes bya'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pas mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are the applications of mindfulness and so on.üîΩIt should be understood that all topics are included in these ten kinds of love. This shows the essence of the analytical knowledge of the meaning, its classification, and how the bodhisattva comes to have the analytical knowledge of the meaning by concluding from that.

original: de'i 'og tu bstan pa'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni byams pa yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa lngas don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bstan pa'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni byams pa yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa lngas don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: After that, the essence of the analytical knowledge of the meaning, its classification, and how the bodhisattva comes to have the analytical knowledge of the meaning by concluding from that are shown by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMaitreya, the bodhisattva‚Äôs analytical knowledge of the meaning is fivefold,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir yang don rnam pa lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don so so yang dag par rig pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cing chung mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir yang don rnam pa lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don so so yang dag par rig pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cing chung mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, in order to destroy the pride of those who think they have the perfect knowledge of the meaning and to prevent others from doing so, the topics are taught in the Summary of the Great Vehicle.

original: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa ni ngo bo nyid kyang bstan to //üîΩbyams pa de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bshad pas de bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa ni ngo bo nyid kyang bstan to // byams pa de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bshad pas de bstan te /
translated: By that, the nature of the perfect knowledge of the meaning is also taught.üîΩMaitreya, the basis of perfect knowledge is the five topics.

original: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang bstan to //
translated: Thus, by that, the classification of the perfect knowledge of the meaning is also taught.

original: de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni gnas skabs de dag thams cad kyis bstan par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni gnas skabs de dag thams cad kyis bstan par sbyar ro //
translated: The bodhisattva's perfect knowledge should be applied to all those situations.

original: de la bstan pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa don yongs su shes par bya ba'i yul yongs su shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu thams cad dang bsdus pa ste /üîΩde la yongs su @183a * //
analyzed: de la bstan pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa don yongs su shes par bya ba'i yul yongs su shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu thams cad dang bsdus pa ste / de la yongs su @183a * //
translated: The phrase the entire content of the teaching refers to the content of the Buddha's teaching that is to be understood, the nature of understanding, and all the results of understanding.üîΩThe content of the teaching is twofold:

original: shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don to //
translated: the content that is to be understood and the content of understanding.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ni yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ni yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The nature of understanding is the understanding itself.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i 'bras bu ni yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / de rab tu rig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i 'bras bu ni yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / de rab tu rig par byed pa ste /
translated: The result of understanding is the attainment of the result of understanding and the knowledge of that attainment.

original: de ni bstan pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni bstan pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the understanding of the teaching and its content.

original: shes bya thams cad ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad do //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad do //
translated: All objects of knowledge are the side of affliction and the side of purification.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus,

original: phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po'i thog mar phung po la sogs pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po'i thog mar phung po la sogs pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The aggregates, etc. The aggregates, etc. are the first things that the bodhisattva should understand.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: The words ‚Äúsuch things‚Äù indicate that all the things that are the side of affliction and the side of purification are included.

original: rnam pa ji snyed kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa ji snyed kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By as many as are their aspects means by as many as are their categories.

original: shes bya de'ang zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po de'o //
analyzed: shes bya de'ang zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po de'o //
translated: That object of knowledge means that thing that is to be understood.

original: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid do //
translated: As they are means as they exist through their characteristics.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos bstan pa'i don rnam pa bcu ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos bstan pa'i don rnam pa bcu ston te /
translated: This verse shows the ten topics of the teaching of the Lord Buddhas.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi don dang / nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi don dang / rkyen las byung zhing dus rtogs pa'i don dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i don dang / rnam par bzhag pa bden pa'i don dang / rnam par ma bzhag pa bden pa'i don dang /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi don dang / nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi don dang / rkyen las byung zhing dus rtogs pa'i don dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i don dang / rnam par bzhag pa bden pa'i don dang / rnam par ma bzhag pa bden pa'i don dang /
translated: The two truths, the topics of harm and benefit, the topics of arising from conditions and realization in time, the topics of impermanence and suffering, the topics of the truth of formulation and the truth of non-formulation,

original: bsdu ba dang / dbye ba'i don dang / lan gdab pa'i don dang / gsang ba dang / bsgrags pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsdu ba dang / dbye ba'i don dang / lan gdab pa'i don dang / gsang ba dang / bsgrags pa'i don to //
translated: the topics of inclusion and division, the topics of reply and question, and the topics of secret and open.

original: de la bden pa gnyis kyi don ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de la bden pa gnyis kyi don ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The two truths are taught by the words ‚Äúconventional‚Äù and ‚Äúultimate.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bden pa gnyis la brten nas chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bden pa gnyis la brten nas chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Lord Buddhas teach the Dharma based on the two truths.

original: nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi don ni skyon dang yon tan zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi don ni skyon dang yon tan zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The topics of harm and benefit are taught by the words ‚Äúfault‚Äù and ‚Äúvirtue.‚Äù

original: bden pa gnyis bstan pa der yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyi nyes dmigs brjod la /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis bstan pa der yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyi nyes dmigs brjod la /
translated: In the teaching on the two truths, the faults and problems of the defilement process are described.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phan yon brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phan yon brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the two truths is also for the purpose of describing the faults of the addictions and the benefits of purification.

original: rkyen las byung zhing dus su rtog pa'i don ni rkyen dang dus zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rkyen las byung zhing dus su rtog pa'i don ni rkyen dang dus zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarising from conditions and being momentary‚Äù is indicated by ‚Äúconditions‚Äù and ‚Äútime.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag kyang rkyen rnams las byung ba yin gyi dbang @183b phyug la sogs pa las byung ba ma yin pa dang / de dag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus su rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag kyang rkyen rnams las byung ba yin gyi dbang @183b phyug la sogs pa las byung ba ma yin pa dang / de dag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus su rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those phenomena of addiction and purification arise from conditions, not from a divine creator, etc., and they are understood as being in the past, present, and future.

original: mi rtag pa'i don ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù is indicated by ‚Äúhaving the character of arising, enduring, and ceasing.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag kyang phal cher 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams kyis rab tu phye bas mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag kyang phal cher 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams kyis rab tu phye bas mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those phenomena that are afflicted and purified are impermanent because they are distinguished by the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i don ni nad la sogs pas zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i don ni nad la sogs pas zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The meaning of suffering is taught by the words ‚Äúdue to disease, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams kyis rab tu phye ba'i mi rtag pa de dag ni nad dang shu ba dang zug rngu dang / sdig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams kyis rab tu phye ba'i mi rtag pa de dag ni nad dang shu ba dang zug rngu dang / sdig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those impermanent phenomena that are distinguished by the characteristics of conditioned states are suffering because they are characterized by disease, carbuncles, and so on, and by evil deeds, etc.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i don ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i don ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The meaning of establishment is taught by the words ‚Äúsuffering, origination, etc.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag kyang nyan thos kyi theg par ni bden pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag kyang nyan thos kyi theg par ni bden pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those phenomena that are afflicted and purified are established as the four noble truths in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa'i don ni de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa'i don ni de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The meaning of the truth that is not posited is indicated by such expressions as thusness, reality limit, and reality realm.

original: chos de dag kyang theg pa chen por ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: chos de dag kyang theg pa chen por ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: And those dharmas are taught in the Mahayana as follows: Whether Tathagatas arise or not,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dbyings de ni chos gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dbyings de ni chos gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the realm of dharmas, the reality realm, abides as the stability of dharmas.

original: bsdu ba dang dbye ba'i don ni bsdu ba dang dbye ba zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: bsdu ba dang dbye ba'i don ni bsdu ba dang dbye ba zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The meaning of inclusion and division is indicated by inclusion and division.

original: chos de dag kyang mdor bsdu ba dang / rgyas par dbye ba gnyis kyis ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang mdor bsdu ba dang / rgyas par dbye ba gnyis kyis ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And those dharmas are taught by means of both a brief inclusion and an extensive division.

original: lan gdab pa'i don ni mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / dris te lan gdab pa dang / gzhag pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: lan gdab pa'i don ni mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / dris te lan gdab pa dang / gzhag pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The meaning of reply is indicated by reply by way of a single statement, by way of analysis, by way of a counter question, and by way of setting aside.

original: chos de dag gi dris pa lan 'debs na yang rnam pa de bzhis lan 'debs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dag gi dris pa lan 'debs na yang rnam pa de bzhis lan 'debs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When answering questions about those phenomena, he answers with those four modes.

original: de la mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba la thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur zhes mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba la thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur zhes mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, answering in a single way is like answering in a single way when asked, ‚ÄúDo all sentient beings die?‚ÄùüîΩAnswering by distinguishing is like distinguishing and answering when asked, ‚ÄúDo all who die take birth?‚Äù

original: rnam par dbye zhing lan gdab pa zhes bya ba ni shi ba thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba la gang dag nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa de dag ni skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye zhing lan gdab pa zhes bya ba ni shi ba thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba la gang dag nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa de dag ni skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have afflictions take birth.

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa med pa de dag ni skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes rnam par @184a * //
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa med pa de dag ni skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes rnam par @184a * //
translated: Those who are without afflictions do not take birth.‚Äù

original: phye ste lan gdab pa lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phye ste lan gdab pa lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Answering by asking a question is like asking a question in return when asked, ‚ÄúIs the self permanent or impermanent?‚Äù

original: dris te lan gdab pa ni zhes bya ba ni mi rnams khyad par du 'phags pa yin nam dman pa yin zhes 'dri ba las gang la ltos te 'dri zhes phyir dris nas gal te ngan song rnams la ltos te 'dri'o zhes zer na ni khyad par du
analyzed: dris te lan gdab pa ni zhes bya ba ni mi rnams khyad par du 'phags pa yin nam dman pa yin zhes 'dri ba las gang la ltos te 'dri zhes phyir dris nas gal te ngan song rnams la ltos te 'dri'o zhes zer na ni khyad par du
translated: and you ask in return, To whom are they compared? If they reply, I ask in comparison to the lower rebirths, you should reply, They are superior.

original: 'phags pa yin no zhes lan gdab pa dang / gal te lha rnams la ltos te 'dri'o zhes na ni dman pa yin no zhes lan gdab pa lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa yin no zhes lan gdab pa dang / gal te lha rnams la ltos te 'dri'o zhes na ni dman pa yin no zhes lan gdab pa lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: If they reply, I ask in comparison to the gods, you should reply, They are inferior.üîΩThe reply by way of setting aside is like the following: If someone asks, Is the self the same as the aggregates or different from them?

original: gzhag pas lan gdab pa ni bdag phung po rnams dang gcig gam tha dad ces 'dri ba la bdag gtan med pas phung po rnams dang gcig gam tha dad par 'gyur ba yod re skan snyam du don gyi dbang de yid la byas te cang mi smra bas
analyzed: gzhag pas lan gdab pa ni bdag phung po rnams dang gcig gam tha dad ces 'dri ba la bdag gtan med pas phung po rnams dang gcig gam tha dad par 'gyur ba yod re skan snyam du don gyi dbang de yid la byas te cang mi smra bas
translated: you should think, Since the self does not exist at all, how could it be the same as or different from the aggregates?

original: lan gdab pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan gdab pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: You should reply by setting aside the question.

original: gsang ba dang bsgrags pa'i don ni gsang ba dang bsgrags pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: gsang ba dang bsgrags pa'i don ni gsang ba dang bsgrags pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The meaning of secret and proclamation is indicated by secret and proclamation.

original: sems can snod du ma gyur pa dag la don zab mo gsang ba dang / snod du gyur pa dag la sgrogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can snod du ma gyur pa dag la don zab mo gsang ba dang / snod du gyur pa dag la sgrogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he teaches the profound secret to those sentient beings who are not vessels, and he proclaims it to those who are vessels.

original: de la rnam pa ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de la rnam pa ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis so //
translated: Therein, it should be understood by way of the varieties that exist, i.e., by way of the varieties of the conventional, the ultimate, etc.

original: mtshan nyid ji lta bu bzhin du yod pa nyid kyis shes par bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji lta bu bzhin du yod pa nyid kyis shes par bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis so //
translated: It should be understood by way of the natures that exist, i.e., by way of the natures of suffering, etc.

original: de gnyis kar 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don de gnyis ka 'dzin par byed pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kar 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don de gnyis ka 'dzin par byed pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: It should be understood by way of the apprehensions of both, i.e., by way of the apprehension of both the entity that is to be understood and the meaning that is to be understood.

original: de'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang yin pa dag ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang yin pa dag ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúthose dharmas that are the factors of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa rtse 'jil ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa rtse 'jil ba'o //
translated: The phrase taming desire, anger, and ignorance refers to the subduing of desire, etc., by means of the applications of mindfulness, etc.

original: ma lus par spong ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su gtugs te sgom pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus par spong ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su gtugs te sgom pa'o //
translated: The phrase abandoning them completely refers to their complete cultivation.

original: dge sbyong nyid ces bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: dge sbyong nyid ces bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The phrase the state of a spiritual practitioner refers to the uncontaminated path.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase its fruits refers to the fruits of the spiritual practitioner, such as the fruit of the stream-winner, etc.

original: yon tan 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase mundane qualities refers to the meditative absorptions, the formless states, etc.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase supramundane refers to the knowledge of termination and the knowledge of non-arising, etc.

original: thun mongs zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon pa zhes @184b bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thun mongs zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon pa zhes @184b bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase common to both refers to the unhindered knowledges, the analytical knowledges, etc.

original: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase uncommon to both refers to the eighteen qualities exclusive to a buddha, etc.

original: mngon du bya ba ni 'bras bu thob pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba ni 'bras bu thob pa'o //
translated: Realization is the attainment of the result.

original: de rab tu rig par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob /
analyzed: de rab tu rig par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob /
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the result of complete understanding.

original: de rab tu rig par byed pa zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rab tu rig par byed pa zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i chos de dag nyid la zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa de dag nyid la'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i chos de dag nyid la zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa de dag nyid la'o //
translated: With regard to those very dharmas that have been realized, that is, with regard to those very results of complete understanding that have been attained,

original: rnam par grol ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: the knowledge of liberation is by oneself.

original: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher ston pa dang yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis rtogs pa'i shes pa gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher ston pa dang yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis rtogs pa'i shes pa gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa'o //
translated: And teaching it extensively to others, and correctly demonstrating it, is the knowledge of teaching that conveys one's own understanding to others.

original: byams pa don lnga po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni bstan pa'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: byams pa don lnga po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni bstan pa'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: And by the statement ‚ÄúMaitreya, you should know that all topics are included in these five topics,‚Äù he teaches the essence of the knowledge of the branches of the scriptures, their divisions, and how the bodhisattva practices the knowledge of the branches.

original: de'i 'og tu sems la brtags pa'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni byams pa yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bzhis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems la brtags pa'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni byams pa yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bzhis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: After that, he teaches the essence of the knowledge of the topics, its divisions, and how the bodhisattva practices the knowledge of the topics by the statement ‚ÄúMaitreya, the bodhisattvas‚Äô knowledge of the topics is fourfold.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang don rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pas don so so yang dag par rig pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cig chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir yang don rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pas don so so yang dag par rig pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cig chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, by the question, the teaching of the discernment of the object is taught in order to destroy pride and to avoid the loss of the teaching.

original: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang bstan to //
translated: By that very question, the nature of the discernment of the object is also taught.

original: bshad pa dang rab tu dbye ba ni logs shig tu ma bstan te skabs de nyid kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa dang rab tu dbye ba ni logs shig tu ma bstan te skabs de nyid kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation and the divisions are not taught separately, but should be understood from the context.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni gnas skabs de dag thams cad kyis bstan par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni gnas skabs de dag thams cad kyis bstan par sbyar ro //
translated: And that is to be applied to the teaching of all those states of the bodhisattva's discernment.

original: de la sems la brtags pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyu brtag pa dang / sems kyi myong ba brtag pa dang / sems kyi rnam par rig pa brtag pa dang / sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa brtag pa dang /
analyzed: de la sems la brtags pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyu brtag pa dang / sems kyi myong ba brtag pa dang / sems kyi rnam par rig pa brtag pa dang / sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa brtag pa dang /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúall that is to be examined with regard to mind is included‚Äù is that the meaning of the applications of mindfulness of body, feeling, mind, and phenomena are included in the examination of the cause of mind, the examination of the experience of mind, the examination of the cognition of mind, the examination of the afflicted mind,

original: rnam @185a * //üîΩpar byang ba brtag pas go rims bzhin du lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rnam @185a * // par byang ba brtag pas go rims bzhin du lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: and the examination of the purified mind.

original: de la sems kyi rgyu brtag pa ni sems kyi len pa'i don ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de la sems kyi rgyu brtag pa ni sems kyi len pa'i don ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: The examination of the cause of mind is indicated by the meaning of ‚Äúthe mind that appropriates.‚Äù

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu gnyis po kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / rten dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can len pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu gnyis po kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / rten dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can len pa ste /
translated: The cause of the foundation consciousness is the two: the habitual tendency of firm adherence to the imagined nature and the appropriation of the physical sense faculties that are its support.

original: de nyid kyi lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the application of mindfulness to the body is also indicated by that.

original: sems kyi myong ba brtag pa ni myong ba'i don ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: sems kyi myong ba brtag pa ni myong ba'i don ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: The investigation of the experience of mind is indicated by the meaning of experience.

original: bdag go snyam du rnam par rig par tshor ba rnam pa gsum myong ba ste /
analyzed: bdag go snyam du rnam par rig par tshor ba rnam pa gsum myong ba ste /
translated: The experience of the three kinds of feeling is the perception of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyis tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the application of mindfulness to feeling is also indicated by that.

original: sems kyi rnam par rig pa brtag pa ni rnam par rig pa'i don ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par rig pa brtag pa ni rnam par rig pa'i don ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: The investigation of the perception of mind is indicated by the meaning of perception.

original: dmigs pa rnam par rig pas sems tsam du rig pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par rig pas sems tsam du rig pa ste /
translated: The perception of mind-only is the perception of the object.

original: de nyid kyis sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the application of mindfulness to mind is also indicated by that.

original: sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba brtag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba brtag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: The investigation of the defilement and purification of mind is indicated by the meaning of defilement and purification.

original: sems de nyid kyi sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi gnas dang dmigs pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs pa dang / rtogs pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ste /üîΩde nyid kyis chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: sems de nyid kyi sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi gnas dang dmigs pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs pa dang / rtogs pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ste / de nyid kyis chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
