translated: The meaning of the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the absence of essence is to be understood as the thorough knowledge of the absence of essence in the object, the thorough knowledge of the absence of essence in the designation, the thorough knowledge of the absence of essence in the verbal designation, and the thorough knowledge of the absence of essence in the full analysis of the object.üîΩThe meaning of the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the object is to be understood as the thorough knowledge of the object as a collection, the thorough knowledge of the object as a basis, the thorough knowledge of the object as a mental support, and the thorough knowledge of the object as a full analysis.üîΩThe meaning of the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the designation is to be understood as the thorough knowledge of the designation as a collection, the thorough knowledge of the designation as a basis, the thorough knowledge of the designation as a mental support, and the thorough knowledge of the designation as a full analysis.üîΩThe meaning of the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the verbal designation is to be understood as the thorough knowledge of the verbal designation as a collection, the thorough knowledge of the verbal designation as a basis, the thorough knowledge of the verbal designation as a mental support, and the thorough knowledge of the verbal designation as a full analysis.

original: byams pa'i don rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems la brtag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba dang /üîΩde byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: byams pa'i don rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems la brtag pa'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba dang /üîΩde byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the full analysis of the object is to be understood as the thorough knowledge of

original: de'i 'og tu gnas dang gnas pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji lta so so yang dag par rig pa ni byams pa byang chub sems dpas rnam pa gsum gyis @185b don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnas dang gnas pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji lta so so yang dag par rig pa ni byams pa byang chub sems dpas rnam pa gsum gyis @185b don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: The divisions of the analytical knowledge of the teaching are indicated by the statement, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva‚Äôs analytical knowledge of the teaching is threefold.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang don rnam pa gsum gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cing chung mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir yang don rnam pa gsum gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cing chung mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan te /
translated: The analytical knowledge of the teaching is indicated by the statement, ‚ÄúWhat are the three aspects of the teaching?‚Äù and so on. The teaching is indicated in order to destroy the pride of those who think they know the teaching and to prevent the underestimation of those who have not studied.

original: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: The essence of the analytical knowledge of the teaching is indicated by that statement.

original: byams pa de la tshig 'bru'i don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bshad pas de bstan te /
analyzed: byams pa de la tshig 'bru'i don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bshad pas de bstan te /
translated: The explanation of the words of the verse is shown by the words, ‚ÄúHere, the meaning of the words, etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang bstan to //
translated: By that, the analysis of the understanding of the meaning of the teaching is also shown.

original: de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni gnas skabs de dag thams cad kyis bstan par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa ni gnas skabs de dag thams cad kyis bstan par sbyar ro //
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs understanding of the teaching is shown by all those states.

original: de la gnas dang / gnas pa dang / zab pa dang rgya che ba'i don thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba la gnas ni tshig 'bru'i don to //
analyzed: de la gnas dang / gnas pa dang / zab pa dang rgya che ba'i don thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba la gnas ni tshig 'bru'i don to //
translated: There, the words are the meaning of the words.

original: gnas pa ni don gyi don to //
analyzed: gnas pa ni don gyi don to //
translated: The meaning is the meaning of the meaning.

original: de gnyis ni bstan pa zab pa dang / don zab par shes par bya ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni bstan pa zab pa dang / don zab par shes par bya ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: Those two should be known as the profound teaching and the profound meaning, respectively.

original: khams kyi don gyis rgya che ste /
analyzed: khams kyi don gyis rgya che ste /
translated: The vastness is by the meaning of the realm,

original: dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is immeasurable.

original: de ni bstan pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni bstan pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: That is the nature of the understanding of the teaching and the meaning of the teaching.

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sngar chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i skabs su ming dang tshig dang yi ge so so ba dang bsdus pa bstan pa gnag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sngar chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i skabs su ming dang tshig dang yi ge so so ba dang bsdus pa bstan pa gnag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The collection of names, etc. should be understood as they were explained in the context of the knowledge of the teaching.

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The characteristic of reality is due to the object of apprehension.

original: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The characteristic of complete knowledge is due to the subject of apprehension.

original: spang ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'bral ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: spang ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'bral ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The characteristic of abandonment is due to separation.

original: mngon du bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'thob pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'thob pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The characteristic of realization is due to attainment.

original: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chung mi za ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chung mi za ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The characteristic of meditation is due to the method of non-diminution.

original: rnam par rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de kho na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de kho na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristic of differentiation is due to the twofold reality.üîΩIt is like the reality of the mirror and the reality of the reflection.

original: me long gi de kho na dang snang ba'i de kho na zhes bya ba lta bu dang / yongs su shes pa ni dgu ste /
analyzed: me long gi de kho na dang snang ba'i de kho na zhes bya ba lta bu dang / yongs su shes pa ni dgu ste /
translated: There are nine complete knowledges.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dang po'o //üîΩgzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa @186a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dang po'o // gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa @186a * //
translated: The first complete knowledge is the abandonment of the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin in the desire realm.

original: rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second complete knowledge is the abandonment of the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin in the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third complete knowledge is the abandonment of the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth complete knowledge is the abandonment of the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the abandonment of afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the cessation of the form and formless realms.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the abandonment of afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the path of the form and formless realms.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the abandonment of fetters that are compatible with inferior states.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the abandonment of attachment to the form realm.üîΩThe ninth is the abandonment of attachment to the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dgu pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / spang ba ni yongs su rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dgu pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / spang ba ni yongs su rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Abandonment is twofold:üîΩthat abandoned by the path of seeing and that abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: mthong bas spang ba dang / bsgom pas spang ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / mngon du bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mthong bas spang ba dang / bsgom pas spang ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / mngon du bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Realization is twofold:

original: lam mngon du bya ba dang / 'bras bu mngon du bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩ'thob pa bsgom pa dang / brten pa bsgom pa dang / spang ba bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu la sogs par de dag gi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam mngon du bya ba dang / 'bras bu mngon du bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste / 'thob pa bsgom pa dang / brten pa bsgom pa dang / spang ba bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu la sogs par de dag gi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Meditation is of four kinds:üîΩmeditation on attainment, meditation on support, meditation on abandonment, and meditation on the antidote.

original: gnas dang gnas par 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos dang don du 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas par 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos dang don du 'brel pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of the connection between the basis and what is based upon it is the connection between the teaching and the meaning.

original: de yang de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa dang / de las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa dang / de las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is a connection by the characteristic of identity and a connection by the characteristic of origination from that.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sgrib pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sgrib pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the Dharma that is an obstruction is obscuration, etc.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni legs par mnyam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni legs par mnyam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the Dharma that is conducive is proper equipoise, etc.

original: nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don yongs su mnyam pa dang / phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don yongs su mnyam pa dang / phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of disadvantage and benefit is the complete equality and excellence of one's own and others' aims.

original: khams lnga ste zhes bya ba ni dpag tu med pa lnga ste /
analyzed: khams lnga ste zhes bya ba ni dpag tu med pa lnga ste /
translated: The five realms are the five immeasurable realms.

original: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad la mkhas par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad la mkhas par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of them, the bodhisattvas become skilled in all.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams @186b dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams @186b dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The world realm is the immeasurable world realm.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten phyogs bcu dpag tu med cing ming yang dpag tu med pa byang chub sems dpas yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten phyogs bcu dpag tu med cing ming yang dpag tu med pa byang chub sems dpas yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: The immeasurable world receptacle in the ten directions, which is immeasurable and has immeasurable names, is to be purified by the bodhisattvas.

original: sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is the immeasurable realm of sentient beings.

original: rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / ma bsgrubs pa'i sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi po byang chub sems dpas yongs su smin par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: rigs yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / ma bsgrubs pa'i sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi po byang chub sems dpas yongs su smin par bya ba dag go //
translated: The sixty-four types of sentient beings, both those who have accomplished the spiritual genes and those who have not, are to be brought to maturity by the bodhisattvas.

original: chos kyi khams zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa ste /üîΩdge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gang dag gis /
analyzed: chos kyi khams zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa ste / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gang dag gis /
translated: The element of mental objects is the immeasurable element of mental objects.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can gyi khams de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpas rtogs par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can gyi khams de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpas rtogs par bya ba dag go //
translated: It is the wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined mental objects by means of which the beings in those world systems are defiled and purified, and which the bodhisattvas understand.

original: gdul ba'i khams zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i khams dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: gdul ba'i khams zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i khams dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The element of those to be trained is the immeasurable element of those to be trained.

original: sems can de dag gi nang na sems can gang dag rigs yang dag par bsgrubs shing skal ba dang ldan pa gtan du sdug bsngal las thar bar byar rung ba byang chub sems dpas rnam par grol bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi nang na sems can gang dag rigs yang dag par bsgrubs shing skal ba dang ldan pa gtan du sdug bsngal las thar bar byar rung ba byang chub sems dpas rnam par grol bar bya ba dag go //
translated: It is those beings among those beings who are suitable to be liberated by the bodhisattvas, who have the right lineage, who are fortunate, and who are capable of being liberated from suffering forever.

original: 'dul ba'i thabs kyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i thabs kyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The element of the means of training is the immeasurable element of the means of training.

original: sems can de dag nyid rnam par thar par bya ba'i thabs byang chub sems dpas lags par bstan par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: sems can de dag nyid rnam par thar par bya ba'i thabs byang chub sems dpas lags par bstan par bya ba dag go //
translated: The method by which those sentient beings are liberated is the teaching of the bodhisattva.üîΩOne should know that all meanings are included in these three meanings of love.

original: byams pa don rnam pa gsum po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gnas dang gnas pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rab
analyzed: byams pa don rnam pa gsum po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gnas dang gnas pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i don thams cad bsdus pas don so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rab
translated: This shows the essence of the analytical knowledges, their divisions, and their summary in terms of the profound and vast meanings of the basis and what is based on it.

original: tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: tu dbye ba dang / de byang chub sems dpas ji ltar so so yang dag par rig pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: It also shows the summary of the analytical knowledges by bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad
analyzed: de ltar mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad
translated: In order to prevent the degeneration and loss of the path of serenity and insight, which is distinguished by the absence of pride and the destruction of pride, the teaching and explanation of the Dharma is shown.

original: pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa yin no /
translated: The explanation of the ascertainment of the designation is taught in order to eliminate manifest pride and to prevent the loss of the ascertainment of the designation.

original: // / de'i 'og tu zhi gnas tsam gyis chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir @187a * //
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu zhi gnas tsam gyis chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir @187a * //
translated: After that, in order to prevent the loss of mere serenity,

original: gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: the meaning of the words of the ascertainment of the designation and so on are explained.

original: zhi gnas tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi shes pa dang mthong ba med pa'i zhi gnas 'ba' zhig gis so //
analyzed: zhi gnas tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi shes pa dang mthong ba med pa'i zhi gnas 'ba' zhig gis so //
translated: Mere serenity refers to mere serenity without the wisdom and insight of insight.

original: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi
analyzed: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi
translated: The ascertainment of the designation is taught in order to prevent loss means that since serenity does not perfect the essence of the path of insight, if one is satisfied with mere serenity, then the path of serenity and insight will be lost.

original: ngo bo nyid las rab tu nyams shing chud za bar 'gyur bas de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag dang
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las rab tu nyams shing chud za bar 'gyur bas de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag dang
translated: Because they would degenerate and lose the essence of the path, in order that they not degenerate and lose it, the three wisdoms were taught and explained.

original: / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: The path of insight is classified by the individual correct knowledge of the meaning, by the knowledge derived from meditation and by the essence of seeing.

original: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed pas zhi gnas tsam dang / shes pa dang / mthong ba ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par mi bzung zhing zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su dag pa la brten te /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed pas zhi gnas tsam dang / shes pa dang / mthong ba ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par mi bzung zhing zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su dag pa la brten te /
translated: Here, Arya Maitreya states that others think that since yogis apply themselves to the essence of the path of serenity and insight, they should not be content with just serenity and just a little knowledge and seeing.

original: lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs par bya dgos na /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs par bya dgos na /
translated: If the path of insight is to be perfected,üîΩthen one should think: ‚ÄúWhat is the path of insight that is perfected by the specific kinds of thorough understanding of the meaning through the three kinds of wisdom and by the wisdom that arises from cultivation and by the essence of insight that is seen?‚Äù

original: shes rab rnam gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa brtags nas ;
analyzed: shes rab rnam gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa brtags nas ;
translated: Having examined the thoughts of those who think in this way,

original: bcom ldan 'das thos ba las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhu ba rnam pa gnyis zhus par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thos ba las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhu ba rnam pa gnyis zhus par sbyar ro //
translated: the Lord was asked two questions: ‚ÄúLord, what is the thorough understanding of the meaning that arises from wisdom born of listening?‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir shes rab rnam gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag bstan pas ni zhi gnas tsam gyis chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir shes rab rnam gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag bstan pas ni zhi gnas tsam gyis chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to //
translated: Here, the exposition of the ascertainment of designations is taught in order to prevent the loss of the path of insight by mere tranquility, through the teaching of the specific kinds of thorough understanding of the meaning through the three kinds of wisdom.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pas ni bshad pas de bstan to //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pas ni bshad pas de bstan to //
translated: The knowledge that arises from meditation and the nature of what is seen are taught by the explanation.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ces bya ba ni tshig 'bru la gnas te skye ba yin pas des ni tshig 'bru la sogs pa'i @187b don so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ces bya ba ni tshig 'bru la gnas te skye ba yin pas des ni tshig 'bru la sogs pa'i @187b don so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes ston to //
translated: The wisdom that arises from listening is based on the words and is born from them. It causes one to understand the individual correct knowledge of the meaning of the words, etc.

original: de la tshig 'bru la gnas pa'i don ces bya ba ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge dang / so so ba dang / bsdus pa las brten pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la tshig 'bru la gnas pa'i don ces bya ba ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge dang / so so ba dang / bsdus pa las brten pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning that is based on the words is the meaning that is based on the name, phrase, and syllable, individually and collectively.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i don ces bya ba ni dgongs pa med pa'i don ces bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i don ces bya ba ni dgongs pa med pa'i don ces bya bas bstan to //
translated: The meaning that is literal is taught by the meaning that is not intended.

original: mngon du ma gyur pa'i don ces bya ba ni mnyam pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan mngon du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du ma gyur pa'i don ces bya ba ni mnyam pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan mngon du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The meaning that is not manifest is the image that is similar to the object of knowledge, the objective support of the stage of meditative equipoise, which is not manifest.

original: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i don ces bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pas rnam par thar par byed pa'i brgyud pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i don ces bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pas rnam par thar par byed pa'i brgyud pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúconducive to liberation‚Äù is that the knowledge derived from meditation, by means of the analytical knowledges, is the indirect cause of liberation.

original: rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don ces bya ba ni de nyid kyis mngon sum du rnam par thar par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don ces bya ba ni de nyid kyis mngon sum du rnam par thar par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot conducive to liberation‚Äù is that it is not able to liberate directly by means of that knowledge.

original: so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes bya ba ni kha phyir bltas te 'jug pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes bya ba ni kha phyir bltas te 'jug pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne causes the analytical knowledges‚Äù means that one causes them by means of the wisdom that engages externally.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ces bya ba ni rigs pas tshul bzhin du rtogs pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ces bya ba ni rigs pas tshul bzhin du rtogs pa las byung ba ste /
translated: The wisdom that arises from reflection is that which arises from the proper understanding of the reasonings.

original: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa nyid ma yin pas tshig 'brul gnas pa'i don kho na so so yang dag par rig par byed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa nyid ma yin pas tshig 'brul gnas pa'i don kho na so so yang dag par rig par byed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Since that is not on the level of meditative equipoise, it only causes the analytical knowledges of the meaning that is verbally established.

original: rigs pas tshul bzhin du rtog pa'i rgyus sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: rigs pas tshul bzhin du rtog pa'i rgyus sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes ston to //
translated: The meaning of the non-literal is taught by the cause of proper investigation with reasoning.

original: tshig 'bru la gnas pa kho na'i don ces bya ba ni thos pa'i don la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig 'bru la gnas pa kho na'i don ces bya ba ni thos pa'i don la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the one who is only based on the words is the meaning of the heard.

original: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa dgongs pa can gyi don ces bya ba ni rigs pas brtags pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa dgongs pa can gyi don ces bya ba ni rigs pas brtags pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the non-literal, the intentional, is the meaning of what is investigated with reasoning.

original: mngon du ma gyur pa'i don ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: mngon du ma gyur pa'i don ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The meaning of the not yet manifest is as before.

original: 'on kyang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i mos pas yid la byed pa'i don gyi rjes su 'jug pas snga ma las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i mos pas yid la byed pa'i don gyi rjes su 'jug pas snga ma las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: However, it is superior to the previous one because it engages the meaning of mental attention through faith on the level of meditative equipoise.

original: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su ches mthun pa'i don zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su ches mthun pa'i don zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the very suitable for liberation is because it is the basis of the uninterrupted path.

original: rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The meaning of not causing liberation is as before.

original: 'on kyang de ma thag tu nyon mongs pa las rnam par thar par byed nus pa'i don gyi rjes su 'jug pas snga ma las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //üîΩso so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes bya ba ni rigs pas tshul @188a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ma thag tu nyon mongs pa las rnam par thar par byed nus pa'i don gyi rjes su 'jug pas snga ma las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no // so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes bya ba ni rigs pas tshul @188a * //
translated: However, it is superior to the former because it is engaged in the meaning that is able to liberate from the afflictions immediately.

original: bzhin du rtog pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: bzhin du rtog pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: One understands through the wisdom that arises from cultivation means that one understands through the wisdom that arises from ascertaining the Dharma through reasoning and proper investigation.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ces bya ba ni chos nges par byas pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ces bya ba ni chos nges par byas pa las byung ba ste /
translated: The wisdom that arises from cultivation means that which arises from ascertaining the Dharma.

original: des ni snga ma gnyis ka'i don dang de las khyad par du gyur pa tshig 'bru la gnas pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: des ni snga ma gnyis ka'i don dang de las khyad par du gyur pa tshig 'bru la gnas pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do zhes ston to //
translated: That teaches that it understands the meaning of both the former two and the meaning that is superior to them, such as not being based on the words.

original: tshig 'bru la gnas pa'i don ces bya ba ni snga ma gnyis ka'i don kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig 'bru la gnas pa'i don ces bya ba ni snga ma gnyis ka'i don kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning that is based on the words means that it also understands the meaning of both the former two.

original: tshig 'bru la gnas pa ma yin pa'i don ces bya ba ni brjod pa'i sgra dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig 'bru la gnas pa ma yin pa'i don ces bya ba ni brjod pa'i sgra dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning that is not based on the words means that it is not mixed with the sounds of expression.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i don ces bya ba ni thos pa'i don la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i don ces bya ba ni thos pa'i don la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning that is literal is so called because it is the object of what is heard.

original: dgongs pa can gyi don ces bya ba ni bsams pa'i don la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa can gyi don ces bya ba ni bsams pa'i don la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning that is intended is so called because it is the object of what is thought.

original: shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyis mngon du gyur ba'i don ces bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyis dmigs pa mngon du gyur pas rang rig pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyis mngon du gyur ba'i don ces bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyis dmigs pa mngon du gyur pas rang rig pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning that is manifest is so called because it is the object of self-awareness, which is the meditative object of the image in the domain of concentration that is in conformity with the thing that is to be known, by means of the path of serenity and insight on the stage of meditative equipoise.

original: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su ches shin tu mthun pa'i don ces bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su ches shin tu mthun pa'i don ces bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning that is very suitable for the liberation is so called because it is the nature of the path without obstacles.

original: rnam par thar par byed pa'i don ces bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar par byed pa'i don ces bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning that liberates is so called because it is the suchness of the path of liberation.

original: so so yang dag par rig par byed de zhes bya ba ni nges par gyur pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig par byed de zhes bya ba ni nges par gyur pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: One causes the discernment of the object to be understood by means of the wisdom of certainty.

original: de dag tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no zhes bya bas ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i don dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i don dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pas de dag gi bye brag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no zhes bya bas ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i don dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i don dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pas de dag gi bye brag bstan pa yin no //
translated: The difference between them is that: the first is the object of the stage of non-concentration, the second is the object of the stage of concentration, and the third is the object of the stage of concentration.

original: de ltar shes rab rnam gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab rnam gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the difference between the discernment of the object by means of the three kinds of wisdom,

original: da ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: da ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: now, in order to teach the essence of the knowledge and vision that arise from cultivation, he asks: Blessed One, how does the bodhisattva cultivate serenity and insight?

original: rnam grangs du mas ston par byed mod kyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid 'dzin pa dang / sna tshogs ma yin pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas ston par byed mod kyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid 'dzin pa dang / sna tshogs ma yin pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Although it is taught in many ways, knowledge is the apprehension of ultimate truth, the apprehension of existence as it is, and the apprehension of the non-variety.

original: mthong ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'dzin pa dang / ji snyed yod pa nyid 'dzin pa dang / @188b sna tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'dzin pa dang / ji snyed yod pa nyid 'dzin pa dang / @188b sna tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: Seeing is the apprehension of conventional truth, the apprehension of the extent of existence, and the variety, etc.

original: mdor bsdus te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdor bsdus te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It should be explained in brief. This means the nature should be taught.

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang rnam pa sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang rnam pa sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wisdom of serenity and insight that takes mixed phenomena as its object is knowledge, because of ultimate truth, existence as it is, and the absence of various aspects.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / rnam pa sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / rnam pa sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That insight is the wisdom of serenity and insight which focuses on unmixed phenomena.üîΩThus, because of the conventional truth, the diversity of things, and the variety of aspects, serenity alone does not perfect the essence of the path of insight.

original: de ltar zhi gnas tsam gyis lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid las rab tu nyams shing chud za bar 'gyur bas de
analyzed: de ltar zhi gnas tsam gyis lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid las rab tu nyams shing chud za bar 'gyur bas de
translated: If one is satisfied with that alone, one falls away from the essence of the path of serenity and insight, and one loses it.

original: las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: One does not fall away from that.

original: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas shes rab rnam gsum gyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni zhi gnas tsam gyis chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa yin no //
analyzed: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang bshad pas shes rab rnam gsum gyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i bye brag dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i lhag mthong gi lam gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa ni zhi gnas tsam gyis chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa yin no //
translated: In order to prevent the loss of the three kinds of wisdom that are taught and explained, the teaching of the ascertainment of the designation is distinguished by the correct discrimination of the meaning of each of the three kinds of wisdom, by the knowledge that arises from meditation, and by the path of insight that is distinguished by the nature of seeing. The ascertainment of the designation is taught in order to prevent the loss of mere tranquility.

original: de'i 'og tu phra ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su shes pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phra ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su shes pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, in order to prevent the loss of the knowledge of the arising of the subtle, the meaning of the words of the ascertainment of the designation should be explained.

original: phra ba kun du 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam gsum gyis yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: phra ba kun du 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam gsum gyis yid la byed pas so //
translated: The arising of the subtle refers to the mental attention of the three kinds of wisdom of the stage of meditative equipoise on the suchness of representation.

original: yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes shing /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes shing /
translated: The term thorough understanding refers to the thorough understanding of the dharmas that are devoid of the imagined nature in the dependent nature,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rab tu spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rab tu spangs te /
translated: the thorough abandonment of the dharmas of affliction in the dependent nature,

original: yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thos pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thos pa'o //
translated: and the hearing of the dharmas that are the nature of purification in the perfected nature.

original: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni phra ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su shes pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing @189a * //
analyzed: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni phra ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su shes pas rab tu phye ba'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid de las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing @189a * //
translated: The presentation of the non-wastage refers to the path that is the essence of ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ, which is distinguished by thorough understanding through the arising of the subtle, and the non-degeneration from that.

original: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang / bshad pas phra ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su shes pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa dang / bshad pas phra ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su shes pa gdags pa gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: It is the presentation of the non-wastage that is taught and explained through the arising of the subtle thorough understanding.

original: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyar ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the connection?

original: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam gsum gyis yid la byed pas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa byams pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam gyi ngo bo nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam gsum gyis yid la byed pas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos
translated: Here, noble Maitreya, thinking that others might think, ‚ÄúThe essence of the path of ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ that is fully included in the yoga of yogins and yoginƒ´s is the three wisdoms of the level of meditative equipoise, the suchness of cognition.

original: yongs su shes shing /
analyzed: yongs su shes shing /
translated: By attending to that with the mind, one should understand the phenomenon that is the imaginary nature that does not exist in the dependent nature,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs te /
translated: completely abandon the phenomenon that is the dependent nature of affliction,

original: yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob par bya dgos na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob par bya dgos na /
translated: and attain the phenomenon that is the thoroughly established nature of purification.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul ji lta bu yin snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul ji lta bu yin snyam du sems pa rnams kyi bsam pa la brtags nas /
translated: What is the way that they are presented?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas yid la bgyid pa gang gis mtshan ma gang ji ltar rnam par sel bar bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhus pa rnam pa lngar zhus pa sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas yid la bgyid pa gang gis mtshan ma gang ji ltar rnam par sel bar bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhus pa rnam pa lngar zhus pa sbyar ro //
translated: In this way, the five questions are applied.

original: de la zhu ba dang po 'dir ni yid la bgyid pa gang gis mtshan ma gang ji ltar rnam par sel bar bgyid ces don rnam pa gsum zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la zhu ba dang po 'dir ni yid la bgyid pa gang gis mtshan ma gang ji ltar rnam par sel bar bgyid ces don rnam pa gsum zhus pa yin te /
translated: Here, in the first question, three topics are asked about: by what attention, which signs, and how they are eliminated.

original: de dag gis ni bstan pas phra ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su shes pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bstan pas phra ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su shes pa chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to //
translated: By these, the teaching of the Abhidharma is taught in order to prevent the loss of the knowledge of the subtle teaching.

original: zhu ba lhag ma bzhis ni bshad pas de bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhu ba lhag ma bzhis ni bshad pas de bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the remaining four questions, the explanation of that should be understood.

original: de la yid la bgyid pa gang gis zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
analyzed: de la yid la bgyid pa gang gis zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
translated: Regarding that, in response to the question by what attention?

original: de bzhin nyid yid la byed pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid yid la byed pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, by attending to suchness.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The attention is by means of the three wisdoms of the stage of the establishment of suchness of representation.

original: de ni phra ba kun 'byung bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni phra ba kun 'byung bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of ‚Äúsubtle origination.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma gang rnam par sel bar bgyid lags zhes zhus pa'i lan du chos kyi mtshan ma dang don gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan ma gang rnam par sel bar bgyid lags zhes zhus pa'i lan du chos kyi mtshan ma dang don gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the sign that is eliminated?‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúThe sign of the dharma and the sign of the object are eliminated.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed de /
translated: The sign of the dependent nature is eliminated.

original: des ni gzhan @189b gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spang ba bstan to //
analyzed: des ni gzhan @189b gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spang ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the elimination of the dharma that has the characteristic of the affliction of the dependent.

original: de la chos zhes bya ba ni sngar chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i skabs su ming dang tshig dang yi ges so so yang dag par rig par bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos zhes bya ba ni sngar chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i skabs su ming dang tshig dang yi ges so so yang dag par rig par bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúdharma‚Äù is that which was previously taught as the object of the discernment of the dharma in the context of the discernment of the dharma, which is to be discerned by means of names, phrases, and letters.

original: don ces bya ba ni sngar don so so yang dag par rig par bya ba'i skabs su rnam pa bcu dang lnga dang bzhi dang / gsum gyis so so yang dag par rig par bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni sngar don so so yang dag par rig par bya ba'i skabs su rnam pa bcu dang lnga dang bzhi dang / gsum gyis so so yang dag par rig par bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that which was previously taught as the object of discernment of meaning, by means of the ten, five, four, and three aspects.

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni chos dang don nyid mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni chos dang don nyid mtshan ma ste /
translated: The sign is the sign of the Dharma and meaning,

original: sems kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is synonymous with the aspect of mind.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yin pas gnas gyur par bya dgos pa'i phyir rnam par bsal bar bya ba yin
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yin pas gnas gyur par bya dgos pa'i phyir rnam par bsal bar bya ba yin
translated: Since that is the Dharma that has the characteristic of affliction, the sign of the formative forces, the basis of the imagined characteristic, the domain of conceptual thought, which has the nature of being dependent, it is to be eliminated because it is necessary to transform it.

original: no // ji ltar rnam par sel bar bgyid ces zhus pa'i lan du /
analyzed: no // ji ltar rnam par sel bar bgyid ces zhus pa'i lan du /
translated: How is it eliminated?

original: ming dang ming gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs shing de'i gnas mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ming dang ming gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs shing de'i gnas mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is eliminated by not observing the name and the nature of the name, and by not seeing the sign of its basis.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes shing gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs pas de sel to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes shing gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs pas de sel to //
translated: It is eliminated by knowing the dharmas that are devoid of the imagined nature in the dependent nature, and by abandoning the dharmas that are the nature of the dependent afflictions.

original: de la chos dang don gyi mtshan ma ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yin la /
analyzed: de la chos dang don gyi mtshan ma ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yin la /
translated: Therein, the sign of the dharma and its meaning is the dependent nature, which is the dharma that is the nature of the afflictions.

original: ming la sogs pa'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yin no //
translated: The imagined nature, which is the name, etc., is the dharma that is devoid of nature.

original: ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid dmigs shing zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de la ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes pas rnam par sel ba bstan te /üîΩgzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de la ngo bo nyid dam /üîΩbye brag tu ming btags pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas ming de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid mi @190a * //
analyzed: ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid dmigs shing zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de la ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes pas rnam par sel ba bstan te / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de la ngo bo nyid dam / bye brag tu ming btags pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas ming de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid mi @190a * //
translated: The line one observes the name of the name teaches the elimination of the imagined reality by the knowledge of the realitylessness of the dependent reality.

original: dmigs pas rnam par sel to //
analyzed: dmigs pas rnam par sel to //
translated: The name that is imputed as the essence or the particular of that reality of the dependent reality, which is the basis of the imagined reality, the object of discursive thought, the sign of the compounded, the reality of defilement, is the imagined reality. Therefore, because that name is the realitylessness of essence, one eliminates by not observing the name of the name, the imagined name.

original: de'i 'og nas mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs pas rnam par sel ba bstan te /üîΩkun brtags pa'i ming de'i gnas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gang yin pa de ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa
analyzed: de'i 'og nas mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs pas rnam par sel ba bstan te / kun brtags pa'i ming de'i gnas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gang yin pa de ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa
translated: The line because he does not see even the signs of that shows the elimination of the imagined nature, which is the imagined name, by the thorough knowledge of the dependent nature, which is the object of elimination.üîΩThe dependent nature, which is the basis of the imagined name, is the domain of conceptual thought. The signs of the dependent nature are the signs of the formative forces, which are the basis of the imagined nature. The dharmas that have the nature of defilement are eliminated because they are devoid of essential nature by way of the essential naturelessness of production.

original: nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ming de'i gnas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to //
analyzed: nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ming de'i gnas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to //
translated: Because he does not see even the signs of the dependent nature, which is the basis of the imagined name, he eliminates the dependent nature.

original: rnam par sel to zhes bya bas ni de ltar byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes shing gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs pas gzhan
analyzed: rnam par sel to zhes bya bas ni de ltar byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes shing gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs pas gzhan
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is eliminated‚Äù indicates that, in this way, bodhisattvas, by knowing the reality that is devoid of the imagined reality in the dependent reality and by abandoning the reality that is the dependent reality‚Äôs defiled reality, theyüîΩ

original: gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma de rnam par sel to //
analyzed: gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma de rnam par sel to //
translated: By eliminates it is said that the Bodhisattva, by understanding the reality of the imagined identity in the relative identity, and by abandoning the reality of the defiled state in the relative identity, eliminates the signs of the relative identity.

original: de rnam par bsal nas yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thos pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnam par bsal nas yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thos pa yin te /
translated: By eliminating those, he hears the reality of the purified state in the perfect identity.

original: gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he has the correct understanding of the meaning of suchness in the perfect identity, which is distinguished by the transmutation.

original: ming la ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang yi ge la yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ming la ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang yi ge la yang de bzhin te /
translated: As with names, so it is with phrases and syllables.

original: de dag gis ni chos kyi mtshan ma ji ltar rnam par sel ba bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni chos kyi mtshan ma ji ltar rnam par sel ba bstan te /
translated: This shows how the signs of the teaching are eliminated.

original: don thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni don gyi mtshan ma ji ltar rnam par sel ba bstan to //
analyzed: don thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni don gyi mtshan ma ji ltar rnam par sel ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall objects‚Äù and so on indicates how the signs of objects are eliminated.

original: rnam pa bcu dang / lnga dang / bzhi dang / gsum po dag ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /üîΩde dag gis so so yang dag par rig par bya ba'i don ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yin pas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes na gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan
analyzed: rnam pa bcu dang / lnga dang / bzhi dang / gsum po dag ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin la / de dag gis so so yang dag par rig par bya ba'i don ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yin pas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes na gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan
translated: The ten, five, four, and three aspects are the imagined reality.üîΩThe object that is to be known by means of the thorough knowledge of the object is the relative reality. Therefore, when one thoroughly knows the reality that is devoid of the imagined reality in the relative reality, one abandons the reality that is characterized by the defilement of the relative reality and attains the reality that is characterized by the purification of the perfected reality.

original: nyid kyis chos rab tu spong zhing yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob par 'gyur ba la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyid kyis chos rab tu spong zhing yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob par 'gyur ba la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is also the case with the other thorough knowledge of language and so on.

original: khams kyi bar la zhes bya ba ni sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu @190b smos pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: khams kyi bar la zhes bya ba ni sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu @190b smos pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúup to the elements‚Äù refers to the ten aspects of the thorough knowledge of the object that were mentioned previously.

original: lnga dang / bzhi dang / gsum gyi tha mar khams kyi don rnam pa lnga po 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / gdul ba'i khams dang / gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams zhes smos pa'i bar dag bzung ste /
analyzed: lnga dang / bzhi dang / gsum gyi tha mar khams kyi don rnam pa lnga po 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / gdul ba'i khams dang / gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams zhes smos pa'i bar dag bzung ste /
translated: the element of the world, the element of sentient beings, the element of the teaching, the element of those to be trained, and the element of the means of training.

original: khams kyi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: khams kyi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs shing /
translated: The imagined reality of the element is not perceived.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i gnas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas don gyi mtshan ma gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnam par sel to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i gnas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas don gyi mtshan ma gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnam par sel to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And since the imagined reality, the basis of that, the dependent reality, is not seen, the reality of the object, the dependent reality, which is characterized by defilement, is eliminated.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan ma gang lags pa de yang rnam par sel bar bgyid lags sam zhes bya bas ni de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma rnam par bsal na kun nas nyon mongsüîΩpa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos spong zhing /üîΩrnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob pa yin na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob pa'i dus na yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de yang rnam par rab sal
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan ma gang lags pa de yang rnam par sel bar bgyid lags sam zhes bya bas ni de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma rnam par bsal na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos spong zhing / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob pa yin na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob pa'i dus na yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de yang rnam par rab sal
translated: Thus, if the sign of the dependent nature is eliminated, then afflicted phenomena characterized by the afflictions are abandoned,üîΩand purified phenomena characterized by purification are attained.

original: bar bya ba yin nam zhes zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: bar bya ba yin nam zhes zhus pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then at the time of attaining purified phenomena, is the sign of the object of correct understanding of the perfected suchness also eliminated?‚Äù

original: byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa la ni mtshan ma med de mi dmigs na de la ci zhig rnam par sel bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa la ni mtshan ma med de mi dmigs na de la ci zhig rnam par sel bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúMaitreya, the object of correct understanding of suchness is signless and non-apprehensible. What is there to eliminate in that?‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Suchness is the perfected suchness.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no //
translated: The analytical knowledge of meaning is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni gnyis su dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni gnyis su dmigs pa'o //
translated: Signs are the apprehension of duality.

original: med de mi dmigs na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnyis su dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: med de mi dmigs na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnyis su dmigs pa ste /
translated: If they do not exist and are not apprehended, then the knowledge of all aspects is the nonapprehension of duality.

original: de skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u las kyang /
translated: Thus it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines:

analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa yin /
translated: Subhuti, the object of the knowledge of all aspects is non-entity.

original: rnam pa ni zhi ba yin /
analyzed: rnam pa ni zhi ba yin /
translated: Its aspect is peace.

original: bdag po ni dran pa yin /
analyzed: bdag po ni dran pa yin /
translated: Its governing faculty is mindfulness.

original: mtshan nyid ni med pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni med pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Its characteristic is nonexistence.

original: de la ci zhig rnam par sel bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni btsal ba ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la ci zhig rnam par sel bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni btsal ba ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is eliminated there? There is nothing to be sought.

original: gang med pa rnam par sel bar blo 'jug pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos bdag med pa chud @191a * //
analyzed: gang med pa rnam par sel bar blo 'jug pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos bdag med pa chud @191a * //
translated: The TathƒÅgata taught that the mind that engages in the elimination of what is nonexistent is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has said that the mind that eliminates what is nonexistent is not the abode of the emptiness of the selflessness of dharmas.üîΩThe knowledge of reality of reality overwhelms all signs of dharmas and meanings.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos dang don gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos dang don gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig
translated: The knowledge of reality of reality that is distinguished by the transmutation is the reality of the perfected nature.

original: pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pas rab tu phye ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pas des de rnam par sel to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pas rab tu phye ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pas des de rnam par sel to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the antidote to all signs of the other-dependent nature that are distinguished by the imagination of what is unreal. Therefore, it eliminates them. This is the meaning.

original: de ni gang gis kyang zil gyis mnan par bya ba yin par nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa de ni rnam par bsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gang gis kyang zil gyis mnan par bya ba yin par nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa de ni rnam par bsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This refers to the perfect reality, the object of the analytical knowledge of discernment, which is not something that can be eliminated.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chab rnyog ma can mchis pa'i snod kyi dpe dang / me long yongs su ma dag pa'i dpe dang / mtshe 'u 'khrugs pa'i dpes zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin nyid yid la byed pas zhes bya ba la /

translated: The Lord has given the example of a vessel of water with stirred-up sediment, the example of a mirror that is not polished, and the example of a pool whose lotuses have been crushed.

original: de bzhin nyid ni rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid do //

analyzed: yid la byed pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam gsum gyis yid la byed pas so zhes bshad pa de nyid dmigs kyis ston to //

original: de la dpe de gsum ni mdo gzhan dag las sems rnyog pa can du gyur pa'i nyes pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dpe de gsum ni mdo gzhan dag las sems rnyog pa can du gyur pa'i nyes pa ni gsum ste /

original: de dag gis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sems rnyog pa can du gyur na de bzhin nyid yid la byed cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par mi nus kyi de las bzlog pas ni mi nus so zhes gsungs pa'i dpe yin no //

translated: If one‚Äôs mind becomes turbid with respect to the mind arisen from hearing, reflection, and meditative concentration, then one is unable to attend to reality as it is and to understand it correctly. The opposite of this is the case for one who is able.

analyzed: ma bsgoms pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems nyes pa snga ma gsum gyis rnyog pa can du gyur pas so //

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par mi nus kyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yid la byed cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par mi nus kyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yid la byed cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par mi nus so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúis unable to understand reality as it is‚Äù means that one is unable to attend to the reality of representations and to understand it correctly.

analyzed: sems kyis so sor brtags pa ni gang lags zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems gang dag gis rnam par rig pa'i de @191b bzhin nyid yid la bgyid lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means by what kinds of minds in the stage of meditative concentration one takes to mind the suchness of representation-only.üîΩWhat is the suchness that is intended?

original: de bzhin nyid ni gang las dgongs zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam gsum gyis yid la bgyi pa'i de bzhin nyid de gang lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gnas skabs bcu la mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba ni bcu drug yod par rig par bya'o //

translated: It is called ‚Äúdifficult to eliminate‚Äù because it is the cause for the attachment to the conventional designations of the imagined.

original: de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni ming dang / tshig dang yi ge'i gnas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad stong par mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam gsum gyis yid la byas na de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni ming dang / tshig dang yi ge'i gnas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad stong par mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab rnam gsum gyis yid la byas na de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is removed by the emptiness of all phenomena. This refers to the three kinds of wisdom of the stage of meditative equipoise, which take as their object the emptiness that is the sameness of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, which are the bases of names, phrases, and letters.üîΩThe meaning of the reality of the basis is made fully known by the discernment of reality.

original: gnas pa'i de @192b bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i de @192b bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This refers to two situations:

analyzed: sngar de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun gyi nang na gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe reality of the basis that I have taught as the truth of suffering is the reality that is included among the seven kinds of reality‚Äù is applied to the discernment of meaning.

original: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /
analyzed: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /
