original: skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the continuity of arising, passing away, enduring and changing.

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad kyi nang nas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal yin pas shin tu rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad kyi nang nas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal yin pas shin tu rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the truth of suffering, and since it is the suffering of conditioned states among the three or eight kinds of suffering, it is said to be difficult to discern because it is very hard to understand.

original: de ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang / mtshan gzhi med pa dang / sngon dang / phyi ma'i mtha' med pas stong pa nyid du yid la byas na de la rnam par sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang / mtshan gzhi med pa dang / sngon dang / phyi ma'i mtha' med pas stong pa nyid du yid la byas na de la rnam par sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is eliminated by the emptiness of characteristics and the emptiness of no beginning or end.

original: 'dzin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gsum pa ste /
translated: The third is the object of retention, which is the object of retention of the retention of Dharma.

original: sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa bcu'i skabs su 'dzin pa'i don ni skye mched gzugs can lnga dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa bcu'i skabs su 'dzin pa'i don ni skye mched gzugs can lnga dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Previously, in the context of the ten correct knowledges of objects, the object of grasping was taught to be the five physical sense bases, mind, thought, consciousness, and mental factors. The correct knowledge of objects is applied to that.

original: de la ni mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la ni mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba gnyis yod de /
translated: Here, there are two difficult-to-remove signs:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma dang / nga'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma dang / nga'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: the sign of the view of the transitory collection and the sign of the thought I am.

original: de gnyis ni 'dzin pa'i don rnams las sems las byung ba'i chos 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yin pas shin tu dbul bar dka' bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'dzin pa'i don rnams las sems las byung ba'i chos 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yin pas shin tu dbul bar dka' bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those two are mental factors among the objects of grasping, namely the view of the transitory collection and the pride thinking I am. Because they are very difficult to remove, they are called difficult-to-remove.

original: de ni nang stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni nang gi phung po stong pa dang / bdag mi dmigs par yid la byas na de gnyis rnam par sel bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nang stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni nang gi phung po stong pa dang / bdag mi dmigs par yid la byas na de gnyis rnam par sel bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when one attends to the emptiness of the internal aggregates and the non-apprehension of a self, those two are eliminated.

original: gzung ba'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bzhi pa ste /üîΩsngar don so @193a * //
analyzed: gzung ba'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bzhi pa ste / sngar don so @193a * //
translated: The fourth state is that which causes the understanding of the individual meanings of the objects that are apprehended.

original: so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su bzung ba'i don gyi phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag yin no zhes bstan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su bzung ba'i don gyi phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag yin no zhes bstan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Previously, in the context of the ten individual correct knowledges of objects, it was taught that the objects that are apprehended are the six external sense-spheres.

original: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /
analyzed: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /
translated: Here, there is a difficult sign to be eliminated.

original: longs spyod la lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod la lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the view of enjoyment.

original: de ni yul yid du 'ong ba bdag gir bya ba yin pas rjes su 'chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yul yid du 'ong ba bdag gir bya ba yin pas rjes su 'chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the basis for the appropriation of attractive objects, it is called difficult to remove.

original: de ni phyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba'i phyi'i yul rnams stong par yid la byas nas de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba'i phyi'i yul rnams stong par yid la byas nas de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is removed by the emptiness of the external, because it is removed by bringing to mind the emptiness of external objects.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa'i don du skyes pa dang / bud med kyi bsnyen bkur dang yo byad dang ldan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs lnga pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa'i don du skyes pa dang / bud med kyi bsnyen bkur dang yo byad dang ldan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifth stage is that of the person who is born for the sake of sexual pleasure and who is endowed with the service and possessions of a man or woman.

original: sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su longs spyod kyi don ni yongs su longs spyad pa'i phyir ngas sems can rnams kyi yongs su bzung ba dang / yo byad bstan pa gang dag yin pa rnams so zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su longs spyod kyi don ni yongs su longs spyad pa'i phyir ngas sems can rnams kyi yongs su bzung ba dang / yo byad bstan pa gang dag yin pa rnams so zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Previously, in the context of the ten kinds of analytical knowledges, the meaning of enjoyment was explained as follows: ‚ÄúThe things that I have taught sentient beings to enjoy and to possess are the enjoyments and the requisites.‚Äù

original: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba gnyis yod de /
translated: Here, there are two difficult-to-dispel signs:

original: nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma dang / phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma dang / phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: the sign of inner pleasure and the sign of outer beauty.

original: de gnyis ni yongs su bsdu pa'i dngos po bdun dang yo byad bcu po dag las nang gi tshor ba las log par bde bar mos pa dang / phyi rol gyi bsnyen bkur la sogs pa log par sdug par mos pa yin pas mngon par zhen pa'i gnas kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni yongs su bsdu pa'i dngos po bdun dang yo byad bcu po dag las nang gi tshor ba las log par bde bar mos pa dang / phyi rol gyi bsnyen bkur la sogs pa log par sdug par mos pa yin pas mngon par zhen pa'i gnas kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: These two are the basis of attachment because they are the basis of the two kinds of wrong ideas: the idea of pleasure in the opposite of inner feeling and the idea of beauty in the opposite of outer service, etc., among the seven ways of attracting and the ten requisites. Therefore, they are called ‚Äúdifficult-to-dispel‚Äù because they are the form of the basis of attachment.

original: de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni nang gi bde ba dang / phyi rol gyi sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan ma rmi lam bzhin du phyi nang stong pa dang / nang dang phyi rol la log par mos pa rang bzhin gyis stong par yid la byas na de gnyis rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni nang gi bde ba dang / phyi rol gyi sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan ma rmi lam bzhin du phyi nang stong pa dang / nang dang phyi rol la log par mos pa rang bzhin gyis stong par yid la byas na de gnyis rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when one attends to the internal signs of pleasure and the external signs of suffering as being like a dream, as being empty of external and internal, and as being essentially empty, one eliminates those two.

original: gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs drug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs drug pa ste /
translated: The sixth case is that which causes the discrimination of the meaning of the abode.üîΩPreviously, in the context of the ten kinds of discrimination of objects, the meaning of the abode was taught to be the world systems.

original: sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su gnas kyi don ni 'jig rten gyi khams @193b gang yin pa ste zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su gnas kyi don ni 'jig rten gyi khams @193b gang yin pa ste zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the discrimination of the meaning of the abode is connected with the discrimination of objects.

original: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /
analyzed: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /
translated: There, the difficulty of eliminating signs is one.

original: tshad med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: The sign of the immeasurables.

original: de ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa la rtog pa yin pas g-yeng pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa la rtog pa yin pas g-yeng pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the conception of the immeasurable world systems of the ten directions, it is called difficult to eliminate because it is a type of distraction.

original: de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar stong pa yid la byas na de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar stong pa yid la byas na de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is eliminated by the emptiness of the great, because when one brings to mind the emptiness of all world systems of the ten directions as being like space, it is eliminated.

original: gzugs med pa la brten te zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bdun pa ste /üîΩsngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la brten te zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bdun pa ste / sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Based on the formless, means in the seventh state.üîΩPreviously, in the context of the ten aspects of the knowledge of the object, the object of affliction was explained as threefold:

original: khams gsum pa'i don nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i zhes bstan pa'i nang nas /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i don nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i zhes bstan pa'i nang nas /
translated: the object of the three realms, the object of affliction, karma and birth.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //üîΩde la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro // de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /
translated: It is applied to the meaning of the affliction, karma, and birth of the formless realm.

original: nang gi zhi ba'i rnam par thar ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi zhi ba'i rnam par thar ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: And there is one difficult to eliminate, the sign of the liberation of inner peace.

original: de ni med pa dang ci yang med pa dang / phra bar 'du shes pa la zhi ba rnam par thar par lta ba yin pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //üîΩde ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni de yang 'dus byas kyi khongs su gtogs la /
analyzed: de ni med pa dang ci yang med pa dang / phra bar 'du shes pa la zhi ba rnam par thar par lta ba yin pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o // de ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni de yang 'dus byas kyi khongs su gtogs la /
translated: That is the view of the liberation of peace in the perception of nonexistence, nothingness, and subtle perception. It is called difficult to eliminate because it is a form of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThat is eliminated by the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas thams cad rkyen la rag las pas stong pa nyid du yid la byas na de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad rkyen la rag las pas stong pa nyid du yid la byas na de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is included among conditioned phenomena. If all conditioned phenomena are contemplated as empty because they depend on conditions, that is eliminated.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs brgyad pa ste /
translated: The eighth stage is called ‚Äúthat which causes correct realization of the meaning of reality as it relates to characteristics.‚Äù

original: sngar de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun gyi nang nas mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi chos thams cad kyi gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun gyi nang nas mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi chos thams cad kyi gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the correct realization of the meaning that was previously taught in the context of the seven aspects of reality, namely, ‚Äúthe selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena that relate to the reality of characteristics of all phenomena.‚Äù

original: de la ni mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de la ni mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba bzhi yod de /
translated: In this context, there are four difficult-to-dispel signs.

original: gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos bdag med @194a * //
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos bdag med @194a * //
translated: They are the sign of the selflessness of persons, the sign of the selflessness of phenomena,

original: pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: the sign of mere representation, and the sign of the ultimate.

original: de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas de ltar 'dzin pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas de ltar 'dzin pa yin pas /
translated: These are apprehended in that way by incorrect imagination.

original: mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúdifficult to eliminate‚Äù because it is a form of attachment to characteristics.

original: de la dang bo ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: de la dang bo ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: The first is eliminated by the emptiness of what transcends limits.

original: gang zag gtan med pas dgag pa yang gtan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag gtan med pas dgag pa yang gtan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The negation of the complete nonexistence of a person is also completely nonexistent.

original: gnyis pa ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
translated: The second is eliminated by the emptiness of nonthings.

original: chos dngos po med pas dgag pa yang gtan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dngos po med pas dgag pa yang gtan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The negation of the nonexistence of things is also completely nonexistent.

original: gsum pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
translated: The third is eliminated by the emptiness of the nature of nonthings.

original: 'khrug pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig pa ni gnyis med pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig pa ni gnyis med pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The awareness of the nature of agitation is the nature of nonthings because it is nondual.

original: bzhi pa ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
translated: The fourth is eliminated by the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa dam pa dang / de'i don de bzhin nyid ni kun brtags pa'i tha snyad dang bral ba dang / yang dag pa ma yin pas kun rtog pa gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa dam pa dang / de'i don de bzhin nyid ni kun brtags pa'i tha snyad dang bral ba dang / yang dag pa ma yin pas kun rtog pa gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the holy, true knowledge, and the reality which is its object, are distinguished by the transformation of the unreal imagination, because they are free from the conventional designations of imagination.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs dgu pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs dgu pa ste /
translated: The ninth stage is called the stage of the correct knowledge of the meaning of reality in its purity.

original: sngar de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun gyi nang nas rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun gyi nang nas rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The correct knowledge of the meaning of the previously taught seven kinds of reality is applied to the correct knowledge of the meaning of the cessation truth.

original: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two difficult things about that:

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: the sign of the unconditioned and the sign of immutability.

original: de gnyis ni 'gog pa la 'dus ma byas pa dang / phung po med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin pas 'jig tshogs 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma phra mo yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'gog pa la 'dus ma byas pa dang / phung po med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin pas 'jig tshogs 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma phra mo yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since both of these are the subtle signs that focus on the cessation of the perishing aggregates, they are called difficult to eliminate.

original: de la dang po ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
translated: The first is eliminated by the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cessation is the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: gnyis pa ni 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel te /
translated: The second is eliminated by the emptiness of the unchanging.

original: 'gyur ba med pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is called unchanging.

original: dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called undropped.

original: 'gyur ba dang dor ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i ming gi rnam @194b grangs so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang dor ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i ming gi rnam @194b grangs so //
translated: The term perishing aggregates is a synonym for the aggregates.

original: de med pa ni 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: de med pa ni 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa ste //
translated: The absence of that is cessation, nirvana.

original: de ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that is empty of the ultimate nature of nonexistence,

original: de yid la byas na mtshan ma de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yid la byas na mtshan ma de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: when one attends to that, those signs are eliminated.

original: mtshan ma de'i gnyen po stong pa nyid de nyid yid la byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bcu pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma de'i gnyen po stong pa nyid de nyid yid la byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bcu pa ste /
translated: This is the tenth stage.üîΩIn the previous section on the ten kinds of discernment of meanings, the meaning of purification was explained as being the factors that are conducive to enlightenment,

original: sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su rnam par byang ba'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang dag yin pa rnams
analyzed: sngar don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bcu'i skabs su rnam par byang ba'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang dag yin pa rnams
translated: in order to become free from those very three kinds of defilement.

original: te zhes bstan pa las rnam par ma bzhag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: te zhes bstan pa las rnam par ma bzhag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The discernment of the meaning of suchness that has not been previously determined is applied to that.

original: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de /üîΩstong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang mtshan ma rnam par bsal dka' ba cig yod de / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: However, there is a sign that is difficult to eliminate.üîΩIt is the sign of emptiness.

original: de ni stong pa nyid shes pa gang gis mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid de la mngon par zhen pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid shes pa gang gis mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid de la mngon par zhen pa yin pas /
translated: That is because one becomes attached to that emptiness by means of the knowledge of emptiness that eliminates all signs.

original: mthun pa'i chos la sred pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos la sred pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par bsal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúdifficult to eliminate‚Äù because it is craving for the Dharma of the conducive side.üîΩIt is eliminated by the emptiness of emptiness.

original: de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid shes pa gang gis mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar 'gyur pa'i stong pa nyid de yang stong pa nyid du mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid shes pa gang gis mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar 'gyur pa'i stong pa nyid de yang stong pa nyid du mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the wisdom of the level of meditative equipoise that is the emptiness by which all signs are eliminated.

original: rnam gsum gyis yid la byas na mtshan ma de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam gsum gyis yid la byas na mtshan ma de rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The signs are eliminated by mental attention to the three kinds of emptiness.

original: de dag gis kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes na gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yongs su shes na gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: By means of those, when one understands the reality that is devoid of the imagined pattern in the relative pattern, one abandons the reality that is the pattern of the addictive.

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs nas yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs nas yongs su grub pa'i rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, when removing the ten signs, and so on, means that having completely abandoned the phenomena of the characteristics of affliction, the phenomena of the characteristics of purification are fully accomplished.

original: thob par 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: The Blessed One, when removing the ten signs, etc. shows that having completely abandoned the dharmas characterized by the defilement of the other-dependent, one attains the dharmas characterized by the purification of the perfected.

original: byams pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa gzugs brnyan gnyis rnam par sel bar byed pa ste /üîΩdes ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun @195a * //
analyzed: byams pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa gzugs brnyan gnyis rnam par sel bar byed pa ste / des ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun @195a * //
translated: Removing the sign of the image which is the domain of concentration, etc. shows the removal of the two images which are the objects of calm abiding and insight.

original: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa bstan to //
translated: By that, he shows the absence of adherence to the imagined nature in the other-dependent nature.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i mtshan ma las yongs su grol bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i mtshan ma las yongs su grol bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One becomes completely liberated from the signs of the bondage of defilement means that one abandons the dharmas characterized by the dependent defilement.

original: des ni gnas gyur pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni gnas gyur pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This teaches the very transformation.

original: de yang rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gang las grol bar 'gyur ba'i 'ching ba de yang rnam par sel te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gang las grol bar 'gyur ba'i 'ching ba de yang rnam par sel te /
translated: And that is also eliminated means that the bondage from which one becomes liberated is also eliminated.

original: des ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob par 'gyur ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob par 'gyur ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that when one abandons the dharmas characterized by defilement, one attains the dharmas characterized by purification.

original: byams pa stong pa nyid de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos dang don gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi zhes smos pa'i don te /
analyzed: byams pa stong pa nyid de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos dang don gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi zhes smos pa'i don te /
translated: Maitreya, those emptinesses and so on explain the meaning of the above statement Maitreya, through the analytical knowledges of meaning and phenomena, one overwhelms all signs of phenomena and meanings.

analyzed: de la rgod pa zhes bya ba ni nye du dang / yul dang mi 'chi bar rtog pa la brten nas sngon bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' mgur spyad pa rjes su dran pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi zhing 'phyar ba skye ba gang yin pa'o // 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni nye du la sogs pa de dag nyid la rtog pa ni ci'i phyir bdag gis de dag spangs te /
translated: The so-called agitation is the arising of an unquiet, agitated state of mind, on the basis of thoughts of relatives, country, and death, which recollects past laughter, play, joy, and sexual intercourse.

original: rab tu byung snyam pa de lta bu'i rkyen gyis sems 'gyod cing yid la gces pa skye ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung snyam pa de lta bu'i rkyen gyis sems 'gyod cing yid la gces pa skye ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The so-called remorse is the arising of a regretful state of mind, and a mental distress, on the basis of thoughts of those same relatives, etc., thinking, Why did I abandon them and go forth?

original: de'i phyir rgod pa dang 'gyod pa de gnyis ni gzhi mthun pas sgrib pa gcig tu mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgod pa dang 'gyod pa de gnyis ni gzhi mthun pas sgrib pa gcig tu mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, those two, agitation and remorse, are made into one obscuration, since they have a common basis.

original: gzhan yang 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba ma byas pa dang / mi bya ba byas pa dang / 'gyod pa dang po skyes pa de ma rtogs pa de 'gyod pa'i gnas dkris pa de nyid bsal ma nus nas phyi ma'i dus su sems kyi rgyun 'gyod cing yid la gcags ba skye ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba ma byas pa dang / mi bya ba byas pa dang / 'gyod pa dang po skyes pa de ma rtogs pa de 'gyod pa'i gnas dkris pa de nyid bsal ma nus nas phyi ma'i dus su sems kyi rgyun 'gyod cing yid la gcags ba skye ba yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, regret is the arising of regret and mental anguish in the future, due to the inability to eliminate the very entanglement of regret that arises from not understanding the first arising of regret, from not doing what should be done, from doing what should not be done, and from not knowing the basis.

original: de ni rgod pa dang gzhi mi mthun mod kyi ji ltar rgod pas rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam pas nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa ni de bzhin du 'di dang yid mi bde ba'i rnam pas nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir 'dir yang rgod pa

translated: Although it is not similar to agitation in terms of basis, just as agitation does not pacify through the aspect of distraction, this [regret] does not pacify through the aspect of mental dissatisfaction. Therefore, here [regret] is treated as a single obstruction with agitation

original: dang bya ba mthun pas sgrib pa gcig tu mdzad de /

original: rmugs pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang lta ba dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa la sogs pa la brten nas spong ba la sbyor ba ma byas pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad skye ba dang / mthun pa lus dang sems rmugs shing las su mi rung ba gang yin pa'o //

translated: Lethargy is a mental factor that is a basis for the arising of all the defilements, because it is a lack of application to the abandoning of the defilements, and it is a lack of aptitude of body and mind.

analyzed: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pas spong ba'i sbyor ba 'jig par byed pas bya ba mthun pa'i phyir sgrib pa gcig tu mdzad do //
translated: Sleep is a basis for the arising of the defilements, because it is a drawing in of the mind. Since they have the same function, they are considered as one hindrance.

translated: The five kinds of loving kindness and so forth show that the distractions of the bodhisattva who has entered the Great Vehicle, such as attending to the Hƒ´nayƒÅna, are obstacles to the concentration that is the basis of the supramundane, nonconceptual

translated: The external objective supports are all the aspects of objects. Since the mind is distracted by them, it is said that the mind is scattered outward.

analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs @200b pa zhes bya ba ni zhum pa dang rgod par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the secondary mental afflictions of meditative attainment refers to laxity, excitement, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed na zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba'i gnas skabs na phyi rol gyi mtshan ma sdug pa dang mi sdug pa gzung ba gang yin pa de la brten
