translated: When he attends to the body by way of the internal body, the external body, and the internal-external body, and when he establishes mindfulness on the body by way of the body, then the sign of the internal body, the sign of the external body, and the sign of the internal-external body, which are the images that are the domain of concentration, are called here the sign of the appropriator of the mind.

original: myong ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sems de nyid kyi bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa ste /
analyzed: myong ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sems de nyid kyi bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa ste /
translated: The sign of experience is the confusion of the self of that very mind, the view of the self, the pride of the self, and the attachment to the self.

original: des myong ba'i nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gnyi ga'i tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing tshor ba dran pa nye bar 'jog pa na /
analyzed: des myong ba'i nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gnyi ga'i tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing tshor ba dran pa nye bar 'jog pa na /
translated: When he attends to feeling by way of the internal feeling, the external feeling, and the internal-external feeling, and when he establishes mindfulness on feeling by way of feeling, then the sign of the internal feeling, the sign of the external feeling, and the sign of the internal-external feeling, which are the images that are the domain of concentration, are called here the sign of experience.

original: tshor ba la sdug bsngal gyi mtshan ma dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par snang ba gang yin pa nyid 'dir sems kyi myong ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sdug bsngal gyi mtshan ma dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par snang ba gang yin pa nyid 'dir sems kyi myong ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The sign of feeling is the sign of suffering and the sign of suchness, which is the appearance of the image that is the domain of samƒÅdhi.

original: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sems de nyid kyi dmigs pa rnam par rig pa ste /üîΩdes sems tsam du rnam par rig pa'i nang gi sems dang / phyi rol gyi sems dang / phyi nang gnyis ka'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing sems @204a * //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sems de nyid kyi dmigs pa rnam par rig pa ste / des sems tsam du rnam par rig pa'i nang gi sems dang / phyi rol gyi sems dang / phyi nang gnyis ka'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing sems @204a * //
translated: The sign of cognition is the cognition of that mind itself as the object.üîΩWhen one observes the mind with the mindfulness of mind,

original: dran pa nye bar 'jog pa na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar 'jog pa na /
translated: one establishes the mindfulness of mind.

original: sems de la mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa nyid 'dir sems kyi rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems de la mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa nyid 'dir sems kyi rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The sign of the mind‚Äôs cognition is the sign of impermanence and the sign of suchness, which is the appearance of the image that is the domain of samƒÅdhi.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sems de nyid sems dang / sems las byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sems de nyid sems dang / sems las byung ba dag ste /
translated: The signs of defilement and the signs of purification refer to the mind itself and mental factors.

original: de dag gi gnas dang / dmigs pa'i chos la nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / phyi nang gnyis ka'i chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing chos dran pa nye bar 'jog pa na chos de dag ma rtogs pas sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas dang / dmigs pa'i chos la nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / phyi nang gnyis ka'i chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing chos dran pa nye bar 'jog pa na chos de dag ma rtogs pas sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: When one is mindful of the internal, external and both internal and external phenomena that are the basis and the objects of those mental factors, one sees phenomena and establishes mindfulness of phenomena.üîΩWhen one does not understand those phenomena, one is miserable and the signs of defilement are the aspects of selflessness that are the origin of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba bdag med pa'i rnam pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang / de dag gi de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma dang / chos de dag rtogs pas 'gog pa dang lam dang bdag med pa'i rnam pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba bdag med pa'i rnam pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang / de dag gi de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma dang / chos de dag rtogs pas 'gog pa dang lam dang bdag med pa'i rnam pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang /
translated: The signs of their suchness and the signs of purification are the aspects of the truths of cessation and path that are the cessation of suffering and the path that is the relinquishment of suffering.

original: de dag gi de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par snang ba gang yin pa nyid 'dir sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par snang ba gang yin pa nyid 'dir sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The signs of their suchness, appearing in the aspect of the reflection that is the domain of samƒÅdhi, are called the signs of the mind‚Äôs affliction and purification.

original: nang gi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The sign of the inner is the aspect of realizing inner emptiness.

original: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni phyi stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni phyi stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The sign of the outer is the aspect of realizing outer emptiness.

original: de gnyis ka'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni phyi nang stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni phyi nang stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The sign of both is the aspect of realizing inner and outer emptiness.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don la sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don la sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of applying oneself to the benefit of all sentient beings is the aspect of realizing the emptiness of emptiness.

original: de ni de ltar phyi nang gnyi ga stong pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de ni de ltar phyi nang gnyi ga stong pa nyid yin /
translated: That is the emptiness of both inner and outer.

original: stong pa nyid la ni ci yang bsgrub tu med do snyam nas sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ba'i gnyen por ci yang bsgrub tu med do snyam pa'i stong pa nyid de yang stong pas sems can thams cad kyi don la sbyar bar bya'o snyam du stong
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni ci yang bsgrub tu med do snyam nas sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ba'i gnyen por ci yang bsgrub tu med do snyam pa'i stong pa nyid de yang stong pas sems can thams cad kyi don la sbyar bar bya'o snyam du stong
translated: Thinking, In emptiness there is nothing to be accomplished, one might neglect the welfare of sentient beings. The antidote to this is the emptiness that thinks, There is nothing to be accomplished, and this emptiness is also empty. Therefore, one should think, I will apply myself to the welfare of all sentient beings.üîΩüîΩ

original: pa nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o ;
analyzed: pa nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o ;
translated: The antidote to the thought In emptiness there is nothing to be accomplished, is the realization of the emptiness of emptiness, thinking, I will apply myself to the welfare of all sentient beings, because that emptiness which is the thought 'there is nothing to be accomplished' is also empty.

original: / shes pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni chen po stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: / shes pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni chen po stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of consciousness is the aspect of the realization of the emptiness of the great.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad phyi rol gyi dngos po ma yin gyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad phyi rol gyi dngos po ma yin gyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization that all worlds of the ten directions are not external things, but the nature of consciousness.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam @204b gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni don dam pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam @204b gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni don dam pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of suchness, suffering, origin, cessation, and path is the aspect of the realization of the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma bzhag pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'o //
translated: The suchness that is not posited and the four truths that are posited.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of the conditioned is the aspect of realizing the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of the unconditioned is the aspect of realizing the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: rtag pa'i mtshan ma ni zhes bya ba ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan ma ni zhes bya ba ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of permanence is the aspect of realizing the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su gang zag gtan med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su gang zag gtan med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization that there is never a person in the time of permanence or the time of the eternal.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang thams cad pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang thams cad pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of impermanence is the aspect of realizing the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.

original: 'dus byas sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' med pa mi rtag pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' med pa mi rtag pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the realization of emptiness as the impermanence of conditioned things that has no beginning or end.

original: sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of the realization of emptiness as the wishlessness of conditioned things that have the nature of suffering and change is called the sign of the nature of suffering and change.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin dang / 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba tshig gnyis bsdus pa'i mtshan ma gcig dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin dang / 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba tshig gnyis bsdus pa'i mtshan ma gcig dang sbyar ro //
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúthe nature of suffering‚Äù and ‚Äúthe nature of change‚Äù are combined into one sign.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yang phung po'o ;
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yang phung po'o ;
translated: The nature of suffering is the aggregates.

original: /'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin yang phung po ste /
analyzed: /'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin yang phung po ste /
translated: The nature of change is also the aggregates.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the truth of suffering, they have the nature of impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin gyi phung po dang / 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyi phung po de ni dor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin gyi phung po dang / 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyi phung po de ni dor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Those aggregates that have the nature of suffering and the nature of change are called ‚Äúto be abandoned.‚Äù

original: phung po'i ming gi rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: phung po'i ming gi rnam grangs yin no //
translated: are synonyms for the aggregates.

original: dor ba med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dor ba med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The signless is nirvana,

original: de ni sdug bsngal gtan 'gags pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gtan 'gags pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cessation of suffering and has the nature of being unchanging.

original: de rtogs pa'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba med pa'i sa pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba med pa'i sa pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspect of realizing that is called the sign of the nature of the stage of non-suffering and non-change.

original: de la mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of the nature of the unchanging is the aspect of realizing the emptiness of nature.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin de mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin rtag pa yin no snyam pa de rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya @205a * //üîΩbar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin de mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin rtag pa yin no snyam pa de rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya @205a * // bar sbyar ro //
translated: The nature of suffering and change is not that nature, but is a permanent nature of non-change. Realizing that is called realizing the emptiness of nature.

original: de la yang la la 'di snyam du gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la yang la la 'di snyam du gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: In this regard, someone might think, ‚ÄúIf all phenomena are emptiness by nature,

original: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / mos pa dang / khams dang / rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can gang dag gi dbang gis bsam pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / mos pa dang / khams dang / rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can gang dag gi dbang gis bsam pa dang /
translated: The various intentions, latent propensities, interests, elements, lineages, and so on of sentient beings, which are the nature of their conduct such as attachment and so on, would not be possible.

original: bag la nyal sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bag la nyal sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The qualities of the buddhas, such as the knowledge of the various intentions, latent propensities, interests, and elements, would not be tenable.

original: de bas na mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos de dag ni don dam par yod do snyam du sems pa'i chos de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du yid la byed ba na stong pa nyid du mthong ba'i rnam pa de ni mi 'gyur ba'i rang
analyzed: de bas na mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos de dag ni don dam par yod do snyam du sems pa'i chos de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du yid la byed ba na stong pa nyid du mthong ba'i rnam pa de ni mi 'gyur ba'i rang
translated: Therefore, when you contemplate that those phenomena that you think exist ultimately and are of an unchanging nature are empty of inherent nature, that aspect of seeing emptiness is the emptiness of unchanging phenomena.

original: bzhin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dre ba'i mtshan ma 'am /
analyzed: bzhin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba'o // 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dre ba'i mtshan ma 'am /
translated: The sign of the face.

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of the differentiation of the characteristics of the conditioned, or the sign of their intrinsic identity, is the aspect of the realization of the emptiness of characteristics.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ni 'dus ma byas pa ste don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ni 'dus ma byas pa ste don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The differentiation of the characteristics of the conditioned is the unconditioned, which is ultimate reality.

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas te kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas te kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Their intrinsic identity is the conditioned, which is superficial reality.

original: mtshan nyid de gnyis rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pa ste mtshan ma gnyis so sor bgrang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gnyis rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pa ste mtshan ma gnyis so sor bgrang ngo //
translated: The realization that these two characteristics are empty of intrinsic reality is the emptiness of characteristics.

original: thams cad thams cad ces bya bar rig nas thams cad kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni thams cad stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad ces bya bar rig nas thams cad kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni thams cad stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of all things is the aspect of the realization of the emptiness of all things.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization that all things, both conditioned and unconditioned, are empty.

original: gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of the selflessness of the person is the aspect of the realization of the emptiness of non-apprehension,

original: gang zag mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: because one realizes the emptiness of the non-apprehension of the person.

original: chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of the selflessness of things is the aspect of the realization of the emptiness of non-existence,

original: chos rnams dngos po med pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams dngos po med pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: because one realizes the emptiness of the non-existence of things.

original: de ltar zhugs shing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po de bzhin nyid la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs shing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po de bzhin nyid la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Thus, having entered into means having entered into reality, which is the antidote to all signs of the relative.

original: de la mang du gnas pa zhes @205b bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de kun du rten goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la mang du gnas pa zhes @205b bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de kun du rten goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that means being accustomed to and frequently practicing that reality.

original: dus dus su zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi dus dang / lhag mthong gi dus dang / gnyis ka'i dus su'o //
analyzed: dus dus su zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi dus dang / lhag mthong gi dus dang / gnyis ka'i dus su'o //
translated: From time to time means at the time of calm abiding, at the time of insight, and at the time of both.

original: de ltar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens to the bodhisattva who has entered in that way?

original: nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la so so rang rig pa de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la so so rang rig pa de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The seven kinds of knowledge arise in him, which are the realizations of the seven aspects of thusness that are individually intuited in his own personal experience.

original: de la nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la'o //
translated: In this passage, ‚Äúin his own personal experience‚Äù means in the very essence of his mind.

original: so sor rang rig pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa'o //üîΩde bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rang rig pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa'o // de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIndividually intuited‚Äù means nondual.üîΩ‚ÄúThe realizations of the seven aspects of thusness‚Äù are the thusness of arising, etc.

original: shes bya'i dngos po'i ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de bdun du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po'i ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de bdun du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seven are included because they characterize the way things exist, just as they are, among knowable things.

original: shes pa rnam pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam par bdun rtogs pa'i sgo nas shes pa yang rnam pa bdun zhes bya bar zad kyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni rnam pa bdun du dbye ba med de /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam par bdun rtogs pa'i sgo nas shes pa yang rnam pa bdun zhes bya bar zad kyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni rnam pa bdun du dbye ba med de /
translated: The seven aspects of consciousness arise means that the consciousness is said to have seven aspects through the realization of the seven aspects of thusness. But there is no sevenfold division in the nature of consciousness.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid gcig tu zad do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid gcig tu zad do //
translated: It is just the single nature of the path of seeing.

original: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don so so yang dag par rang rig pa'i shes pa de'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid la gnyis med pa'i don so so yang dag par rang rig pa'i shes pa de'o //
translated: That is its path of seeing means that it is the knowledge of the individual correct perception of the meaning of nonduality in the nature of mind.

original: de thob pas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam de'o //
analyzed: de thob pas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam de'o //
translated: By attaining it means by attaining that path of seeing.

original: yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni dang po kho nas de kho na mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni dang po kho nas de kho na mthong ba'o //
translated: The faultless state of reality means seeing that reality for the first time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur bar nges pa'o //
translated: The family of the Tathagata means that one will certainly become a Tathagata.

original: sa dang po zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sa dang po zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The first stage means the stage of The Utterly Joyful One.

original: sa de'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni sa dang po dang phan yon gang dag bstan pa de dag go //
analyzed: sa de'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni sa dang po dang phan yon gang dag bstan pa de dag go //
translated: The benefits of that stage are the benefits of the first stage.

original: des sngar zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ma thob pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: des sngar zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ma thob pa'i dus na ste /
translated: Previously, when he had not attained the path of insight,

original: sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyi yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: he was in the situation of mental attention on the path of preparation.

original: da ltar ni mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te zhes bya ba ni des sangs rgyas kyis nyid la yongs su grub pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: da ltar ni mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te zhes bya ba ni des sangs rgyas kyis nyid la yongs su grub pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Now, having attained the path of insight, he has attained the object of the limit of reality, i.e., he has attained the perfected nature in the state of Buddhahood.

original: dang por sa dang po la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang por sa dang po la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not that he has not previously attained the perfected nature on the first stage, because he has realized it for the first time.

original: dogs pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang med pa ma yin mod kyi yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pas de thob bo zhes ma bstan to //
analyzed: dogs pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang med pa ma yin mod kyi yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pas de thob bo zhes ma bstan to //
translated: And it is not that he has not attained the perfected object, but it is not complete, and so it is not taught that he has attained it.
He has attained the object of the limit of reality,üîΩbut not the object of the perfected nature.

original: gong ma gong ma rnams su zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa yan chad du'o //
analyzed: gong ma gong ma rnams su zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa yan chad du'o //
translated: The higher stages are the second stage and above.

original: dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa'o //üîΩnang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gsum po de la gnyis med pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa'o // nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gsum po de la gnyis med pa'i don gyis te /
translated: When one attends to these three objects, that is, the image with conception, the image without conception, and the object of the ultimate reality,

original: de nyid khye'u ches phra mo lta bur blta bar bya'o //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma ste ;
analyzed: de nyid khye'u ches phra mo lta bur blta bar bya'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma ste ;
translated: one should see them as like a very small child, because of the absence of the two, subject and object.

original: de ni khye'u sbom po lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni khye'u sbom po lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see them as like a stout child, because of the presence of the two, subject and object.

original: mtshan ma rnams zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma rnams so //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma rnams so //
translated: The signs are the other-dependent signs.

original: gnas ngan len rnams zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i bag chags rnams so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rnams zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i bag chags rnams so //
translated: The negative reflex actions are the imagined habitual notions.

original: gser lta bur zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo las dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar du sems rnam par sbyong ba gser la dpe blangs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gser lta bur zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo las dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar du sems rnam par sbyong ba gser la dpe blangs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: As if it were gold means that the ten grounds sutra takes the purification of mind from the first to the tenth ground as an analogy for gold.

original: tshul des na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya zhing dgos pa yongs su grub pa yang 'thob ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshul des na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya zhing dgos pa yongs su grub pa yang 'thob ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: By that method, one attains manifest complete buddhahood up to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment and the accomplishment of one‚Äôs purpose.

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The object of the accomplishment of one‚Äôs purpose is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩMaitreya, if bodhisattvas practice ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ in that way, they will attain manifest complete buddhahood in unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la de ltar sgrub na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngar zhus pa'i lan gyi bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la de ltar sgrub na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngar zhus pa'i lan gyi bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation of the summary of the reply to the question.

original: des ni bstan pas bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag po med pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to /
analyzed: des ni bstan pas bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag po med pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to /
translated: In order to destroy the lack of strong aspiration for meditation and to prevent its loss, the teaching on the ascertainment of the designation is taught.

original: // / de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpas ji ltar bsgrubs na byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par 'grub pas bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag po med par rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab ba bstan pa'i
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpas ji ltar bsgrubs na byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par 'grub pas bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag po med par rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab ba bstan pa'i
translated: After that, in order to destroy the lack of strong aspiration for meditation and to prevent its loss, the teaching on the ascertainment of the designation is taught for the bodhisattva so that by practicing in that way, the great power of the bodhisattva is accomplished.

original: phyir / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po mngon par sgrub pa lags zhes bya ba mngon par zhus so //
analyzed: phyir / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po mngon par sgrub pa lags zhes bya ba mngon par zhus so //
translated: The bodhisattva asked, ‚ÄúHow does the bodhisattva practice so that the great power of the bodhisattva is accomplished?‚Äù

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Therein, the great power of the bodhisattva is fivefold.

original: mngon par shes pa'i mthu dang / @206b chos kyi mthu dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu dang / thun mong gi mthu dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i mthu dang / @206b chos kyi mthu dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu dang / thun mong gi mthu dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i mthu'o //
translated: The power of superknowledge, the power of Dharma, the power of co-emergence, the power of the common, and the power of the uncommon.

original: de la mngon par shes pa'i mthu gang zhe na mngon par shes pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa'i mthu gang zhe na mngon par shes pa drug ste /
translated: What is the power of superknowledge? It is the six superknowledges.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: The superknowledge of manifesting the field of miracles, the superknowledge of manifesting the knowledge of the divine ear, the superknowledge of manifesting the knowledge of the various mental states, the superknowledge of manifesting the knowledge of remembering past lives,

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: the superknowledge of manifesting the knowledge of death, transmigration, and rebirth, and the superknowledge of manifesting the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni gang /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni gang /
translated: What is the domain of supernatural power?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi shes pa ni gang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi shes pa ni gang /
translated: What is the knowledge of supernatural power?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the realization of the knowledge of the domain of supernatural power?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya ba ni gcig tu gyur pas mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rgyas par tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang sgyur bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya ba ni gcig tu gyur pas mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rgyas par tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang sgyur bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa ste /
translated: The domain of supernatural power is the transformation of one into many, and so on, up to the mastery of the body as far as the Brahma world.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa des yul de nyams su myong ba dang / nye bar ston par byed pas na de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa des yul de nyams su myong ba dang / nye bar ston par byed pas na de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the domain of supernatural power is the experience of that domain and the demonstration of it. Therefore, it is called the domain of supernatural power.

original: de la rnam par bsgyur ba dang sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par bsgyur ba dang sprul pa'o //
translated: It is transformation and emanation.

original: de la yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du bsgyur ba ste g-yo bar byed pa dang / 'bar bar byed pa dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rnam par ston pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de la yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du bsgyur ba ste g-yo bar byed pa dang / 'bar bar byed pa dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rnam par ston pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúTransformation‚Äù means changing the nature of an existent thing, such as moving it, causing it to blaze, causing it to pervade, causing it to appear, causing it to change,

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed pa dang / sdud pa dang rgyas par byed pa dang / gzugs thams cad lus su 'jug par byed pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i gam du 'gro bar byed pa dang / snang bar byed cing mi snang bar yang byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed pa dang / sdud pa dang rgyas par byed pa dang / gzugs thams cad lus su 'jug par byed pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i gam du 'gro bar byed pa dang / snang bar byed cing mi snang bar yang byed pa dang /
translated: causing it to go and come, causing it to contract and expand, causing all forms to enter the body, causing it to go to the same realm, causing it to appear and disappear,

original: dbang byed pa dang / gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon par byed pa dang / spobs pa sbyin pa dang / dran pa sbyin pa dang / bde ba sbyin pa dang / 'od zer 'byin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang byed pa dang / gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon par byed pa dang / spobs pa sbyin pa dang / dran pa sbyin pa dang / bde ba sbyin pa dang / 'od zer 'byin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: causing it to be controlled, causing it to overcome the supernormal powers of others, causing it to give eloquence, causing it to give mindfulness, causing it to give bliss, causing it to emit light rays. Such things are called ‚Äútransformations.‚Äù

original: de la sprul pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa las sprul pa'i sems kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sprul pa ste /
analyzed: de la sprul pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa las sprul pa'i sems kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sprul pa ste /
translated: Emanation is the creation of a desired object by a mind of emanation from a non-existent object.

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is of three types:üîΩemanation of body,

original: lus sprul pa dang / ngag sprul pa dang / @207a * //
analyzed: lus sprul pa dang / ngag sprul pa dang / @207a * //
translated: emanation of speech,

original: yul sprul pa'o //
analyzed: yul sprul pa'o //
translated: and emanation of objects.

original: de la lus sprul pa ni bdag dang 'dra ba'am mi 'dra bar sprul pa dang / gzhan dang 'dra ba 'am mi 'dra bar sprul pa dang / lus kyi sprul pa mang po sprul pa ste /
analyzed: de la lus sprul pa ni bdag dang 'dra ba'am mi 'dra bar sprul pa dang / gzhan dang 'dra ba 'am mi 'dra bar sprul pa dang / lus kyi sprul pa mang po sprul pa ste /
translated: Emanation of body is the emanation of a body like oneself or unlike oneself, or the emanation of many bodies.

original: de dag kyang dbang po dang 'dra ba dang / dbang po'i rten sprul par byed kyi dbang po nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang dbang po dang 'dra ba dang / dbang po'i rten sprul par byed kyi dbang po nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is like the sense faculties, and it emanates a support for the sense faculties, but it does not emanate the sense faculties themselves.

original: ngag sprul pa ni gdangs snyan pa dang / skad gsal ba dang / bdag dang 'brel ba dang / gzhan dang 'brel pa dang / gnyis ka dang ma 'brel pa dang / chos ston par rtogs pa dang / bag med pa la bskul bar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag sprul pa ni gdangs snyan pa dang / skad gsal ba dang / bdag dang 'brel ba dang / gzhan dang 'brel pa dang / gnyis ka dang ma 'brel pa dang / chos ston par rtogs pa dang / bag med pa la bskul bar rtogs pa'o //
translated: Emanation of speech is the emanation of a pleasant voice, a clear voice, a voice related to oneself, a voice related to another, a voice related to both, a voice that understands the teaching of Dharma, and a voice that understands the exhortation to be heedful.

original: yul sprul pa ni zas dang skom la sogs pa dang / nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg byar rtogs pa phyi rol gyi yo byad thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sprul pa ste /
analyzed: yul sprul pa ni zas dang skom la sogs pa dang / nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg byar rtogs pa phyi rol gyi yo byad thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sprul pa ste /
translated: The object of magical emanation is the magical emanation of all external objects, such as food and drink, jewels and pearls, forms, sounds, smells, tastes and touchables, just as one wishes.

original: yongs su bsgyur ba dang / sprul pa de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsgyur ba dang / sprul pa de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of magical emanation and the object of transformation are combined into one, which is called the object of magical emanation.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa zhes bya ba ni mthu de dang ldan pa'i shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa zhes bya ba ni mthu de dang ldan pa'i shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the object of magical emanation is the result of meditation on the knowledge that possesses that power, which is the result of meditation.

original: shes pa de ni yul de nyams su myong ba dang / nye bar ston par 'gyur bas na de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa de ni yul de nyams su myong ba dang / nye bar ston par 'gyur bas na de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That knowledge is called the knowledge of the object of magical emanation because it experiences that object and reveals it to others.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya ba ni shes pa de nyid kyi sa bon skye ba'i rkyen gyis yongs su zin cing yongs su brtas pa gang zag de'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya ba ni shes pa de nyid kyi sa bon skye ba'i rkyen gyis yongs su zin cing yongs su brtas pa gang zag de'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The superknowledge that is the direct realization of the object of miraculous transformation is the seed of that knowledge itself, which is fully developed by the condition of birth and which is present in the stream of consciousness of that person.

original: sa bon yongs su brtas pas gang zag des shes pa de mngon du byed par gyur pas de'i phyir de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon yongs su brtas pas gang zag des shes pa de mngon du byed par gyur pas de'i phyir de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because that person actualizes that knowledge through the development of the seed, it is called the superknowledge that is the direct realization of the object of miraculous transformation.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of these are combined into one and are called the superknowledge that is the direct realization of the object of miraculous transformation.

original: de'i las ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i las ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Its action is twofold:

original: sems can rnams rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis 'dun par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'dzud par byed pa dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la phan gdags pa rnam pa du ma mang po sna tshogs nye bar sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis 'dun par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'dzud par byed pa dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la phan gdags pa rnam pa du ma mang po sna tshogs nye bar sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Having attracted beings by means of the magical wonder, he introduces them to the teaching of the Buddha. He also accomplishes for them the various kinds of benefit, in many ways and by various means.

original: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The superknowledge that consists of the knowledge of the divine ear.

original: lha'i rna ba ni gang /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba ni gang /
translated: What is the divine ear?

original: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa ni gang /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa ni gang /
translated: What is the knowledge of the divine ear?

original: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /üîΩlha'i rna @207b ba zhes bya ba ni lha'i gnas pa bsam gtan rnams bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu rna bas bsdus pa'i gzugs dang ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na / lha'i rna @207b ba zhes bya ba ni lha'i gnas pa bsam gtan rnams bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu rna bas bsdus pa'i gzugs dang ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: What is the superknowledge that consists of the knowledge of the divine ear?üîΩThe divine ear is the subtle matter included in the ear, which is the result of the meditation of the absorptions of the gods.

original: lha'i rna ba de lha'i gnas ba de la brten pa dang / de'i 'bras bu dang des bsdus pas na de'i phyir lha'i rna ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba de lha'i gnas ba de la brten pa dang / de'i 'bras bu dang des bsdus pas na de'i phyir lha'i rna ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The divine ear is called divine because it is based on the divine, because it is the result of the divine, and because it is included in the divine.

original: des ni lha dang mi'i sgra dang 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams dang / sgra bo che rnams dang / sgra chung ngu rnams dang / gsal ba rnams dang / mi gsal ba rnams dang / sprul pa rnams dang / sprul pa ma yin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: des ni lha dang mi'i sgra dang 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams dang / sgra bo che rnams dang / sgra chung ngu rnams dang / gsal ba rnams dang / mi gsal ba rnams dang / sprul pa rnams dang / sprul pa ma yin pa rnams dang /
translated: It hears the sounds of gods and humans, the sounds of ƒÅryas and non-ƒÅryas, the sounds of the great and the small, the sounds of the manifest and the unmanifest, the sounds of emanations and the sounds of what are not emanations,

original: thag ring ba rnams dang / thag nye ba rnams thos ba yin te /üîΩde dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: thag ring ba rnams dang / thag nye ba rnams thos ba yin te / de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: the sounds of the distant and the sounds of the near.üîΩIn brief, it hears the sounds of the differences in the abodes of beings, the differences between the well-spoken and the poorly spoken, the differences in size, the differences in whether or not they are understood, the differences in whether or not they are powerful,

original: 'gro ba'i gnas kyi khyad par dang / legs par gsungs pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i khyad par dang / che chung gi khyad par dang / go bar byed pa dang mi byed pa'i khyad par dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gnas kyi khyad par dang / legs par gsungs pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i khyad par dang / che chung gi khyad par dang / go bar byed pa dang mi byed pa'i khyad par dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: and the differences in the near and the far.

original: thag nye ring gi khyad par yin pas der sgra'i khyad par thams cad 'dus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thag nye ring gi khyad par yin pas der sgra'i khyad par thams cad 'dus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, all the differences in sound should be seen as included in those.

original: de la gsal te 'og dang steng dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan las brtsams te /üîΩthos par 'jug par mi byed na ni 'og tu mnar med pa la thug pa yan chad /üîΩsteng du 'og min la thug pa man chad thad kar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i khams gcig tshun chad kyi sgra thos so //
analyzed: de la gsal te 'og dang steng dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan las brtsams te / thos par 'jug par mi byed na ni 'og tu mnar med pa la thug pa yan chad / steng du 'og min la thug pa man chad thad kar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i khams gcig tshun chad kyi sgra thos so //
translated: If he does not engage in hearing, he hears sounds from other world systems below, above, and horizontally.

original: gal te 'jug par byed na ni 'og dang sting dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa grangs med pa dag gi sgra thams cad thos te /
analyzed: gal te 'jug par byed na ni 'og dang sting dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa grangs med pa dag gi sgra thams cad thos te /
translated: If he engages in hearing, he hears all the sounds of immeasurable, countless world systems below, above, and horizontally.

original: de ni lha'i rna ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lha'i rna ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the divine ear.

original: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the divine ear is the knowledge of the ear consciousness and the knowledge concomitant with it that arises from meditation and is the result of meditation.

original: shes pa de ni sgra de dag thos pa dang / nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir lha'i rna ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa de ni sgra de dag thos pa dang / nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir lha'i rna ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That cognition is the hearing and experience of those sounds. Therefore, it is called the cognition of the divine ear.

original: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba ni shes pa de nyid kyi sa bon skye ba'i rkyen gyis yongs su zin cing yongs su brtas pa gang zag de'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba ni shes pa de nyid kyi sa bon skye ba'i rkyen gyis yongs su zin cing yongs su brtas pa gang zag de'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The manifestation of the cognition of the divine ear is the seed of that cognition, which is fully developed by the condition of arising and is present in the continuum of that person.

original: sa bon yongs su brtas pas gang zag des shes pa de mngon du byed par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir de ni lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya'o //üîΩde dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lha'i @208a * //
analyzed: sa bon yongs su brtas pas gang zag des shes pa de mngon du byed par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir de ni lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya'o // de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lha'i @208a * //
translated: Because that person manifests that cognition through the development of the seed, it is called the manifestation of the cognition of the divine ear.

original: rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of those are combined into one and are called the cognition that is the manifestation of the cognition of the divine ear.

original: de'i las ni ngag gi spyod pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dag thos nas sems can de dag la ci rigs ci 'os par na nan tan byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i las ni ngag gi spyod pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dag thos nas sems can de dag la ci rigs ci 'os par na nan tan byed pa yin no //
translated: Its action is that, after hearing virtuous and nonvirtuous verbal actions, one practices in relation to those sentient beings in whatever way is appropriate and fitting.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la sems kyi rnam grangs ni gang /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la sems kyi rnam grangs ni gang /
translated: What is the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the categories of mind?

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa ni gang /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa ni gang /
translated: What is the knowledge of the categories of mind?

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the manifestation of the knowledge of the categories of mind?

original: sems kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa dag na sems can 'khod pa rnams kyi sems nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa dang / nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba dang nyon mongs pa dang 'brel cing bag la nyal dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa dag na sems can 'khod pa rnams kyi sems nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa dang / nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba dang nyon mongs pa dang 'brel cing bag la nyal dang bcas pa dang /
translated: The categories of mind are the minds of sentient beings dwelling in the infinite and innumerable world systems of the ten directions, minds that are entangled with afflictions, minds that are free from the entanglement of afflictions, minds that are connected with afflictions and have latent tendencies,

original: nyon mongs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin zhing bag la nyal med pa dang / smon lam log par btab pa dang / smon lam legs par btab pa dang / dman pa dang / bar ma dang / gya nom pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin zhing bag la nyal med pa dang / smon lam log par btab pa dang / smon lam legs par btab pa dang / dman pa dang / bar ma dang / gya nom pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang /
translated: minds that are not connected with afflictions and do not have latent tendencies, minds that have made wrong aspirations, minds that have made good aspirations, inferior minds, middling minds, excellent minds, minds that are happy,

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the mental activity of sentient beings, whether they are happy, unhappy, or neither unhappy nor happy.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i shes pa mthu dang ldan pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i shes pa mthu dang ldan pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the categories of mind is the powerful knowledge that has that as its object. It is the result of cultivation, which arises from cultivation.

original: shes pa gcig gis sems can gcig gi sems gang yin pa dang / ji lta bu dang / ji 'dra ba dang / ji snyed par gnas pa thams cad cig car yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //üîΩshes pa gcig kho nas sems can mang po dag gi sems gang yin pa dang ji lta bu dang ji 'dra ba dang ji snyed nye bar gnas pa thams cad dang cig car yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas na de'i phyir sems kyi rnam
analyzed: shes pa gcig gis sems can gcig gi sems gang yin pa dang / ji lta bu dang / ji 'dra ba dang / ji snyed par gnas pa thams cad cig car yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so // shes pa gcig kho nas sems can mang po dag gi sems gang yin pa dang ji lta bu dang ji 'dra ba dang ji snyed nye bar gnas pa thams cad dang cig car yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas na de'i phyir sems kyi rnam
translated: By means of a single knowledge, one knows simultaneously and as it really is all the minds of sentient beings, whatever they are, however they are, of whatever kind they are, and however many there are.

original: grangs shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grangs shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By means of a single knowledge, one knows simultaneously and as it really is all the minds of many sentient beings, whatever they are, however they are, of whatever kind they are, and however many there are. Therefore it is called the knowledge of the categories of mind.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the categories of mind is as above.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the categories of mind is the combination of all of these.

original: de'i las ni sems can rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs shes pa dang / khams dang spyod pa sna tshogs @208b shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam sna tshogs shes pas de dag tu ci rigs par sbyor ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i las ni sems can rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs shes pa dang / khams dang spyod pa sna tshogs @208b shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam sna tshogs shes pas de dag tu ci rigs par sbyor ba byed pa yin no //
translated: Its action is to know the faculties of sentient beings, to know their various inclinations, to know their various elements and practices, and to know the various paths that lead to nirvana.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the recollection of former abodes.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni gang /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni gang /
translated: What is the recollection of former abodes?

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa ni gang /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa ni gang /
translated: What is the cognition of the recollection of former abodes?

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /üîΩsngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i sems can gyi ris rnam pa sna tshogs dag na /üîΩsems can ming dang brda sna tshogs rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa rnams kyi sngon 'das pa'i rabs dag gi lus kyi rnam pa mngon par brjod pa na /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i sems can gyi ris rnam pa sna tshogs dag na / sems can ming dang brda sna tshogs rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa rnams kyi sngon 'das pa'i rabs dag gi lus kyi rnam pa mngon par brjod pa na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the memory of former abodes?üîΩThe memory of former abodes is the memory of the various categories of sentient beings in the ten directions.

original: tha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad la brten pa'i spyod pa drug rjes su dran pa gang yin pa ste /üîΩtha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad gang zhe na /üîΩming ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩrigs ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩrus ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩzas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /üîΩbde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /üîΩtshe ring khyad ni 'di tsam zhig / yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /üîΩtshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad la brten pa'i spyod pa drug rjes su dran pa gang yin pa ste /üîΩtha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad gang zhe na /üîΩming ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩrigs ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩrus ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩzas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /üîΩbde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /üîΩtshe ring khyad ni 'di tsam zhig / yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /üîΩtshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub ces bya ba'o //
