original: tha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad la brten pa'i spyod pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad la brten pa'i spyod pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six types of conduct that are based on the eight conventional bases?

original: bod pa'i brda dang / rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs rnams dang / pham dang zas skom la sogs pa'i bya ba dang / dar ba dang / rgud pa dang / tshe'i rnam pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: bod pa'i brda dang / rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs rnams dang / pham dang zas skom la sogs pa'i bya ba dang / dar ba dang / rgud pa dang / tshe'i rnam pa sna tshogs te /
translated: The Tibetan language, the castes such as the warrior caste, the actions such as defeat and eating and drinking, prosperity, decline, and the various aspects of life.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten tha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad po de dag la brten nas bdag dang / gzhan dag gi spyod pa drug po dag tha snyad 'dogs pa na bdag gam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten tha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad po de dag la brten nas bdag dang / gzhan dag gi spyod pa drug po dag tha snyad 'dogs pa na bdag gam /
translated: Thus, when one designates the six types of conduct of oneself and others in dependence on these eight conventional bases of the world, one designates the six types of conduct in terms of oneself and others.

original: 'di'i ming ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di'i ming ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: The name of this one is such and such.

original: bdag gam 'di'i rigs ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag gam 'di'i rigs ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: The caste of this one is such and such, such as the warrior caste.

original: bdag gam 'di'i pha ma ni 'di yin pas rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag gam 'di'i pha ma ni 'di yin pas rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: The clan of this one is such and such because the parents of this one are such and such.

original: bdag gam 'di'i zas skom la sogs pa'i bya bas zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: bdag gam 'di'i zas skom la sogs pa'i bya bas zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: The food of this one is such and such because the actions of this one are such and such, such as eating and drinking.

original: bdag gam 'di dar ba dang rgud pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig 'byung /
analyzed: bdag gam 'di dar ba dang rgud pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig 'byung /
translated: The happiness and suffering of this one is such and such because this one is prosperous and declines.

original: bdag gam 'di'i na tshod ni gzhon pa'am /
analyzed: bdag gam 'di'i na tshod ni gzhon pa'am /
translated: The self or this person is young,

original: bar ma 'am rgan pa 'di tsam zhig gnas gnas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar ma 'am rgan pa 'di tsam zhig gnas gnas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: middle-aged, or old, and it has lived for this long.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag gi sngon 'das pa'i tshe rabs dag gi lus kyi rnam pa tha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad la brten pa'i spyod pa drug po de dag rjes su dran pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa @209a * //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag gi sngon 'das pa'i tshe rabs dag gi lus kyi rnam pa tha snyad kyi gzhi brgyad la brten pa'i spyod pa drug po de dag rjes su dran pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa @209a * // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The recollection of the six types of conduct based on the eight bases of designation of the body in one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô past lives is called ‚Äúrecollection of past lives.‚Äù

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa zhes bya ni dran pa de la brten cing de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa mthu dang ldan pa bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang gis de la dran pa 'jug pa gang yin pa ste
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa zhes bya ni dran pa de la brten cing de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa mthu dang ldan pa bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang gis de la dran pa 'jug pa gang yin pa ste
translated: The knowledge of the recollection of past lives is the powerful knowledge that is based on that recollection and is concomitant with it. It is the result of meditation, the result of the meditation that causes that recollection to occur.

original: / shes pa des bdag dang gzhan dag gi sngon gyi gnas dang / srid pa bar ma dang / sngon gyi spyod pa nyung ngu dang / mang po dang / tshad med pa dang / skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa'i rgyun bar chad med pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: / shes pa des bdag dang gzhan dag gi sngon gyi gnas dang / srid pa bar ma dang / sngon gyi spyod pa nyung ngu dang / mang po dang / tshad med pa dang / skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa'i rgyun bar chad med pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa dang /
translated: By means of that knowledge, he enters into the uninterrupted stream of the past lives of himself and others, the intermediate state, and the past conduct, whether small, great, or immeasurable, in an instant, a moment, a second, and so on.

original: bskal ba bgrang ba'i tshul gyis grangs su byar nus pa'i cha dang / grangs su byar mi nus pa'i dus dpag tu med pa dag dang / gang 'dod pa dang / ji tsam 'dod pa la shes pa thogs pa med par 'jug par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskal ba bgrang ba'i tshul gyis grangs su byar nus pa'i cha dang / grangs su byar mi nus pa'i dus dpag tu med pa dag dang / gang 'dod pa dang / ji tsam 'dod pa la shes pa thogs pa med par 'jug par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He enters into the past with the method of counting eons, whether it is possible to count or not, and he enters into the past without obstruction, as much as he wishes and for as long as he wishes. Therefore, it is called the knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: de mngon du bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The actualization of that is the same as before.üîΩThe actualization of the higher knowledge of the recollection of past lives is the combination of all of those.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the recollection of past lives is the higher knowledge that is the knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: de'i las ni sems can rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dad pa bskyed pa dang / 'khor ba las skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mchog rmad du byung ba skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde snod sna tshogs bstan pa dang /
analyzed: de'i las ni sems can rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dad pa bskyed pa dang / 'khor ba las skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mchog rmad du byung ba skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde snod sna tshogs bstan pa dang /
translated: Its function is to teach the various collections of Jataka tales, the marvelous conduct of the bodhisattva, in order to generate faith in the Bhagavat Buddha in sentient beings and to generate disgust for cyclic existence.

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las brtsams te /
translated: It teaches the various collections of Vaipulya scriptures, beginning with the results of the evolution of the actions of sentient beings.

original: sngon gyi tshul dang ldan pa'i de lta bu byung ba'i sde snod sna tshogs ston pa dang / sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rtag par smra ba dang / kha cig rtag par smra ba rnams kyi rtag par lta ba sel bar byed pa yin no //üîΩ'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la 'chi 'pho dang skye ba ni gang /
analyzed: sngon gyi tshul dang ldan pa'i de lta bu byung ba'i sde snod sna tshogs ston pa dang / sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rtag par smra ba dang / kha cig rtag par smra ba rnams kyi rtag par lta ba sel bar byed pa yin no // 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la 'chi 'pho dang skye ba ni gang /
translated: It teaches the various collections of the Nidana scriptures, which are related to the past, and it eliminates the views of permanence of those who speculate about the past and who are proponents of permanence.üîΩThe superknowledge that is the direct realization of death, transmigration, and rebirth. What is death?

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa ni gang /
translated: What is the knowledge of death and rebirth?

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the clear knowledge of death and rebirth?

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang ; kha dog ngan pa dang / kha dog bzang ba dang / ngan pa dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / lus dang /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang ; kha dog ngan pa dang / kha dog bzang ba dang / ngan pa dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / lus dang /
translated: Death and rebirth means that sentient beings die and are reborn, have bad or good complexions, go to bad or good destinies, and have bodies,

original: ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ldan pa log par lta ba 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang / ldan pa log par lta ba 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa /
translated: speech, and minds that are endowed with bad conduct, have wrong views, and slander the noble ones.

original: log pa'i las ni mngon par 'du byed pa /
analyzed: log pa'i las ni mngon par 'du byed pa /
translated: They engage in wrong actions.üîΩBecause of their wrong commitments, by that cause and that condition, after their bodies disintegrate and they die, they are reborn in the bad destinies, the lower realms, the hells.

original: yang dag @209b par blangs pa'i rgyus rgyu de dang / rkyen des lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa yang dag par lta ba 'phags pa rnams la yid ches pa /
analyzed: yang dag @209b par blangs pa'i rgyus rgyu de dang / rkyen des lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa yang dag par lta ba 'phags pa rnams la yid ches pa /
translated: Those who have bodies, speech, and minds that are endowed with good conduct, have right views, and have confidence in the noble ones,

original: yang dag pa'i lam mngon par 'du byed pa yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus rgyu de dang / rkyen des lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba sems can gyi ris de dang de nas shi 'phos nas sems can gyi ris de las gzhan bar skye ba gang yin
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam mngon par 'du byed pa yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus rgyu de dang / rkyen des lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba sems can gyi ris de dang de nas shi 'phos nas sems can gyi ris de las gzhan bar skye ba gang yin
translated: Due to the cause of taking up the correct path, and due to that cause and condition, after the body breaks up, after death, one is reborn among the gods and humans of the happy destinies, in the higher realms, in that and that class of sentient beings, and after passing away from that class of sentient beings, one is reborn in another class of sentient beings.

original: pa'o ; /'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni lha'i mig gi shes pa ste /
analyzed: pa'o ; /'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni lha'i mig gi shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of death and rebirth is the knowledge of the divine eye.

original: lha'i mig ces bya ba ni lha'i gnas pa bsam gtan rnams bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mig gis bsdus pa'i gzugs dang ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig ces bya ba ni lha'i gnas pa bsam gtan rnams bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mig gis bsdus pa'i gzugs dang ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The divine eye is the clear form included in the eye that is the result of cultivating the dhyanas, the divine abodes.

original: lha'i mig de lha'i gnas pa de la brten pa dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / des bsdus pas na de'i phyir lha'i mig ces bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig de lha'i gnas pa de la brten pa dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / des bsdus pas na de'i phyir lha'i mig ces bya'o //
translated: Because that divine eye is based on those divine abodes, it is the result of those, and it is included in those, therefore it is called the divine eye.

original: des na 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba ji skad bstan pa de dag dang / snang ba dang / cha phra ba dang / gzugs sprul pa dang / lha'i gzugs dar  ba yang mthong ste /
analyzed: des na 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba ji skad bstan pa de dag dang / snang ba dang / cha phra ba dang / gzugs sprul pa dang / lha'i gzugs dar  ba yang mthong ste /
translated: Therefore, he sees the various kinds of death and rebirth as they have been described, and he sees the light, the subtle, the emanated forms, and the divine forms.

original: der gzugs kyi khyad par thams cad 'dus par blta bar bya'o //üîΩde la gal te 'og dang steng dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan las brtsams te /
analyzed: der gzugs kyi khyad par thams cad 'dus par blta bar bya'o // de la gal te 'og dang steng dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan las brtsams te /
translated: All the different kinds of form should be seen as included in these.

original: mthong ba 'jug par mi byed na ni 'og tu mnar med pa la thug pa yan chad steng du 'og min la thug pa man chad thad kar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i khams gcig tshun chad kyi gzugs mthong ngo /
analyzed: mthong ba 'jug par mi byed na ni 'og tu mnar med pa la thug pa yan chad steng du 'og min la thug pa man chad thad kar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i khams gcig tshun chad kyi gzugs mthong ngo /
translated: If he does not engage in seeing by taking as his object other world systems below, above, or across, then he sees the form that exists in the world system of four continents, from the Avƒ´ci hell below up to the heaven of the Highest Peak gods above.

original: gal te 'jug par byed na 'og dang steng dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa grangs med pa dag gi gzugs thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: gal te 'jug par byed na 'og dang steng dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa grangs med pa dag gi gzugs thams cad mthong ste /
translated: If he engages in seeing, then he sees all the form that exists in the immeasurable and innumerable world systems below, above, and across.

original: de ni lha'i mig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lha'i mig ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the divine eye.

original: lha'i mig gi shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gi shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the divine eye is the knowledge that is concomitant with the eye consciousness that is supported on that eye. It is the result of meditation, the result of the cultivation of the divine eye.

original: shes pa de ni gzugs de dag mthong ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir lha'i mig gi shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa de ni gzugs de dag mthong ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir lha'i mig gi shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That knowledge is called the knowledge of the divine eye because it experiences the seeing of those forms.

original: de nyid 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is also called the knowledge of death and rebirth.

original: de mngon du bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The realization of that is as previously explained.

original: de dag thams cad @210a * //
analyzed: de dag thams cad @210a * //
translated: All of those

original: gcig tu bsdus pa ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus pa ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are combined into one and called the superknowledge that realizes the knowledge of death and rebirth.

original: de'i las ni phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams kyi lus kyi spyod pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dag gzigs nas ci rigs ci 'os par de dag la nan tan byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i las ni phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams kyi lus kyi spyod pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dag gzigs nas ci rigs ci 'os par de dag la nan tan byed pa yin no //
translated: Its action is that, having seen the virtuous and nonvirtuous physical actions of sentient beings in the ten directions, he practices appropriately and as is fitting for them.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The superknowledge called ‚Äúthe manifestation of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities‚Äù

original: zag pa zad pa ni gang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ni gang /
translated: What is the destruction of the impurities?

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the manifestation of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities?

original: zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba ma lus par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba ma lus par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the impurities is the complete abandonment of the fetters.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i zag pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pas zag pa zad pa de shes pa de gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i zag pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pas zag pa zad pa de shes pa de gang yin pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the impurities is the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities by means of mundane knowledge and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: zag pa thams cad kyi bag la nyal ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir de'i gnyen por gyur pa zag pa med pa'i sems dang zag pa med pa'i shes rab lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab mchog gis bsdus pa ni zag pa zad pas zag pa med pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang /
analyzed: zag pa thams cad kyi bag la nyal ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir de'i gnyen por gyur pa zag pa med pa'i sems dang zag pa med pa'i shes rab lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab mchog gis bsdus pa ni zag pa zad pas zag pa med pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: The manifestation of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities is the liberation of the mind by the absence of the impurities and the liberation through wisdom, which are included in the highest liberation of the mind and the highest liberation through wisdom, because of the complete abandonment of the latent tendencies of all the impurities.

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the manifestation of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: de yang mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam la brten te thos nas slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i sa de nyid la bdag gis thob bo snyam du zag pa zad pa shes pa 'dis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes la des gzhan dag gis de thob pa dang /
analyzed: de yang mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam la brten te thos nas slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i sa de nyid la bdag gis thob bo snyam du zag pa zad pa shes pa 'dis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes la des gzhan dag gis de thob pa dang /
translated: Moreover, having heard that the path of seeing and the path of cultivation are the means for attaining the stage of learning and the stage of no learning, and having attained them, one thinks, ‚ÄúI have attained them.‚ÄùüîΩThis knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants is the correct knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: ma thob pa dang / bdag dang gzhan dag gis de 'thob pa'i thabs dang thabs ma yin pa dang / gzhan dag gis de 'thob pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ni de'i phyir de ni zag pa zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa dang / bdag dang gzhan dag gis de 'thob pa'i thabs dang thabs ma yin pa dang / gzhan dag gis de 'thob pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ni de'i phyir de ni zag pa zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The correct knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants is the correct knowledge of the attainment and non-attainment of others, the correct knowledge of the means and non-means of attaining them by oneself and others, and the correct knowledge of the attainment of others with and without pride.

original: de mngon du bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The realization of the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants is as explained above.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpas ni de mkhyen kyang bdag nyid kyis mngon du mi mdzad de zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po zag pa dang lhan cig tu mi spong bar zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas dpyod
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpas ni de mkhyen kyang bdag nyid kyis mngon du mi mdzad de zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po zag pa dang lhan cig tu mi spong bar zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas dpyod
translated: The bodhisattva knows this, but does not manifest it himself, because he does not abandon contaminated things together with the contaminants, but without defilement in regard to those contaminated things.

original: de / de ni mthu thams cad kyi nang na ches mthu che ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de / de ni mthu thams cad kyi nang na ches mthu che ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the most powerful of all powers.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The combination of all these is called the superknowledge of the realization of the knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: de'i las ni bdag nyid kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur la @210b gzhan la ston cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal yang sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i las ni bdag nyid kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur la @210b gzhan la ston cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal yang sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Its action is that it prevents the bodhisattva from becoming defiled and it teaches others and removes their pride.

original: shes pa drug po de dag dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni dus la bab na nye bar ston pa'am /
analyzed: shes pa drug po de dag dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni dus la bab na nye bar ston pa'am /
translated: The yogi who possesses these six knowledges, when the time is right, teaches,

original: gnas pa'am gzhan dag gi don kun du spyod pa'am /
analyzed: gnas pa'am gzhan dag gi don kun du spyod pa'am /
translated: or abides, or acts for the sake of others.

original: de la dri ba dris pa'i lan gdab pa mngon par shes par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dri ba dris pa'i lan gdab pa mngon par shes par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The answer to the question is the superknowledge. Thus, it is called superknowledge.

original: de la mngon par shes pa dang po gsum ni mngon par shes pa kho na yin gyi rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa dang po gsum ni mngon par shes pa kho na yin gyi rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The first three superknowledges are only superknowledge, not knowledge.

original: tha ma gsum ni mngon par shes pa yang yin la rig pa yang yin te /
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni mngon par shes pa yang yin la rig pa yang yin te /
translated: The last three are both superknowledge and knowledge.

original: dus gsum la kun du rmongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum la kun du rmongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the antidote to the delusion of the three times.

original: de la dang pos ni gzhan dag 'dun par byed de bdag la gzhan dag gus pa dang ri mo cher skyed par yang byed do //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni gzhan dag 'dun par byed de bdag la gzhan dag gus pa dang ri mo cher skyed par yang byed do //
translated: By the first, one attracts others and causes others to generate great respect and reverence for oneself.

original: gnyis pas ni gzhan dag gi ngag gi spyod pa dge ba dang mi dge ba shes nas de dag la bskul ba dang rangs par yang byed do //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni gzhan dag gi ngag gi spyod pa dge ba dang mi dge ba shes nas de dag la bskul ba dang rangs par yang byed do //
translated: By the second, one knows the virtuous and nonvirtuous conduct of others and encourages them and delights them.

original: gsum pas ni gzhan dag gi sems kyi rgyud dge ba dang mi dge ba kun shes par byas nas legs par 'doms par yang byed do //
analyzed: gsum pas ni gzhan dag gi sems kyi rgyud dge ba dang mi dge ba kun shes par byas nas legs par 'doms par yang byed do //
translated: By the third, one instructs others well, having understood the virtuous and nonvirtuous mental continuums of others.

original: tha ma gsum gyis ni rtag pa'i mtha' dang chad pa'i mtha' spangs nas zag pa zad pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par dbu ma'i lam legs par ston cing de la 'doms par yang byed de /
analyzed: tha ma gsum gyis ni rtag pa'i mtha' dang chad pa'i mtha' spangs nas zag pa zad pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par dbu ma'i lam legs par ston cing de la 'doms par yang byed de /
translated: The last three powers are the power of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities, the power of the knowledge of the recollection of previous abodes, and the power of the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.

original: de ni mngon par shes pa'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon par shes pa'i mthu yin no //
translated: These are the powers of the superknowledges.

original: de la chos kyi mthu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi mthu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the powers of the teachings?

original: sbyin pa'i mthu dang / tshul khrims kyi mthu dang / bzod pa'i mthu dang / brtson 'grus kyi mthu dang / bsam gtan gyi mthu dang / shes rab kyi mthu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mthu dang / tshul khrims kyi mthu dang / bzod pa'i mthu dang / brtson 'grus kyi mthu dang / bsam gtan gyi mthu dang / shes rab kyi mthu'o //
translated: The power of generosity, the power of morality, the power of patience, the power of effort, the power of meditation, and the power of wisdom.

original: chos kyi mthu de dag kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mthu de dag kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: These powers of the teachings are also of four kinds:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang ; tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan gdags pa dang / phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang ; tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan gdags pa dang / phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: abandoning the adverse side, maturing the equipment, benefiting oneself and others, and producing results in the future.

original: de la sbyin pa'i mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of power of generosity?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pa na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pa na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
translated: When the bodhisattva gives a gift, he abandons the resistance to generosity.

original: de'i sbyin pa de dag nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i sbyin pa de dag nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: That generosity becomes a factor of enlightenment for him.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pas kyang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //üîΩsbyin pa'i snga rol du yang yid dga' la sbyin pa'i tshe yang sems dang @211a * //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pas kyang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no // sbyin pa'i snga rol du yang yid dga' la sbyin pa'i tshe yang sems dang @211a * //
translated: And by the gift as a means of gathering, he brings sentient beings to full maturity.

original: bar byed cing byin pa'i 'og tu yang 'gyod pa med de /
analyzed: bar byed cing byin pa'i 'og tu yang 'gyod pa med de /
translated: He is happy before he gives, his mind is at ease while he is giving, and he has no regrets after he has given.

original: dus gsum du dga' ba'i sems kyis bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / gzhan dag gi bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / na ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sdug bsngal sel bas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //üîΩphyi rol du yang gang dang gang du skyes par phyug pa dang / longs spyod che ba dang / rtsa 'jing che ba dang / g-yog 'khor mang du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dus gsum du dga' ba'i sems kyis bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / gzhan dag gi bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / na ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sdug bsngal sel bas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no // phyi rol du yang gang dang gang du skyes par phyug pa dang / longs spyod che ba dang / rtsa 'jing che ba dang / g-yog 'khor mang du 'gyur la /
translated: The benefit to oneself is the joy of the thought: I am benefiting myself. The benefit to others is the removal of the suffering of hunger, thirst, cold, heat, sickness, desire, and fear.

original: sbyin pa yang mos par 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang mos par 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: The benefit to oneself and others in the future is the attainment of great wealth, great resources, great power, and a great retinue, wherever one is born, and the delight in generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi mthu rnam pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi mthu rnam pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the power of morality?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa na /
translated: When the bodhisattva takes up the morality of restraint of body and speech,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
translated: The avoidance of the resistance to morality is the avoidance of the resistance to the accessories of enlightenment.

original: de'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: The morality that one has undertaken becomes a cause of one's enlightenment.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: And by the similarity of purpose in the means of gathering disciples, one brings sentient beings to full maturity.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi rkyen gyis 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa spong ba ni bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad par 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med cing mchog tu dga' ba nas sems ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba'i bar gyis bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi rkyen gyis 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa spong ba ni bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad par 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med cing mchog tu dga' ba nas sems ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba'i bar gyis bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang /
translated: The avoidance of the conditions of immorality, the avoidance of fear, the avoidance of blame, the avoidance of enmity, the benefit to oneself through sleeping and waking happily, through the absence of regret, through supreme joy, and through the concentration of the mind,

original: sems can thams cad la yang rnam pa thams cad kyis tho mi 'tshams pas mi 'jigs pa sbyin pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang rnam pa thams cad kyis tho mi 'tshams pas mi 'jigs pa sbyin pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: And since he never harms any sentient being in any way, he benefits others by giving them freedom from fear.

original: lus zhig nas kyang gzhi des bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: lus zhig nas kyang gzhi des bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: And when his body breaks up, on the strength of that, he is reborn in a happy realm, in the celestial world of the gods.

original: tshul khrims la yang mos par 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims la yang mos par 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: And he becomes convinced of the value of moral discipline.

original: bzod pa'i mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bzod pa'i mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of power of patience?

original: byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa dang ldan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi bzod pa spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa dang ldan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi bzod pa spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
translated: The power of patience of the bodhisattva who possesses patience is the elimination of the resistance to patience.

original: de'i bzod pa de bdag nyid kyi byang chub @211b kyi phyogs su gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i bzod pa de bdag nyid kyi byang chub @211b kyi phyogs su gyur pa yin la /
translated: That patience of his becomes a factor in his enlightenment.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: And by means of the means of gathering, namely, giving material goods and making others happy, he brings beings to maturity.

original: bdag nyid 'jigs pa chen po las skyob pas bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang gzhan dag kyang 'jigs pa chen po las skyob pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jigs pa chen po las skyob pas bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang gzhan dag kyang 'jigs pa chen po las skyob pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: By protecting himself from the great fear, he benefits himself. By protecting others from the great fear, he benefits others.

original: gzhi des phyi ma la 'khon pa mang bar mi 'gyur zhing 'byed pa mi mang la /
analyzed: gzhi des phyi ma la 'khon pa mang bar mi 'gyur zhing 'byed pa mi mang la /
translated: By that basis, in the future he does not have much hostility and does not have much division.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not have much suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur la ;
analyzed: 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur la ;
translated: He dies without regret.

original: lus zhig nas kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: lus zhig nas kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: And after the collapse of the body, he is reborn among the gods in a happy heavenly realm.

original: bzod pa la yang mos par 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa la yang mos par 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: And he is inclined to patience. This is the future result.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of power of vigor?

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams te rnam pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs le lo spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams te rnam pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs le lo spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who has begun to practice vigor abandons laziness, which is the opposite of vigor.

original: de'i brtson 'grus de bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i brtson 'grus de bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: That vigor becomes the bodhisattva's own enlightenment factor.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: And by the conformity of the means of gathering, he brings beings to full maturity.üîΩHaving begun to practice vigor, he sees that he is abiding in bliss, unmixed with sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas, and that he has attained a state superior to the former one.üîΩHe is delighted and overjoyed, and he benefits himself.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres par bde ba la reg par gnas pa sngon las gong du khyad par du gyur pa mthong nas dga' zhing mchog tu dga' bas bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pas gzhan la lus dang ngag gis rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres par bde ba la reg par gnas pa sngon las gong du khyad par du gyur pa mthong nas dga' zhing mchog tu dga' bas bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pas gzhan la lus dang ngag gis rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang /
translated: And because he is intent on the side of virtue, he does not harm others with body or speech.

original: gzhan dag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom pa la 'dun pa skyed pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom pa la 'dun pa skyed pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni /
translated: And he also benefits others by causing them to generate the will to undertake effort.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus he benefits both himself and others.

original: phyi ma la yang rgyu stobs dang ldan pa skyes bu'i rtsal mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang rgyu stobs dang ldan pa skyes bu'i rtsal mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: And in the future, he generates a powerful cause for the manifestation of the power of the person.

original: bsam gtan gyi mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa na /üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs tshig gi rtog pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / gzugs kyi 'du shes la sogs pa spong ba @212a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa na / mi mthun pa'i phyogs tshig gi rtog pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / gzugs kyi 'du shes la sogs pa spong ba @212a * //
translated: What are the four kinds of power of the meditative development of the immeasurables?üîΩThe meditative development of the immeasurables is: (a) the relinquishment of adverse elements, (b) the accumulation of the spiritual levels, (c) the accumulation of merit and (d) the accumulation of direct intuition.

original: ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
analyzed: ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
translated: (a) The meditative development of the immeasurables is the relinquishment of adverse elements because the bodhisattva, when entering into the meditative absorptions, relinquishes the adverse elements, i.e. discursive thought, joy, pleasure and the notion of form etc.

original: de'i bsam gtan de dag nyid kyi byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i bsam gtan de dag nyid kyi byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: (b) The meditative development of the immeasurables is the accumulation of the spiritual levels because the bodhisattva who is established on the spiritual level of the joyful one, etc.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin bar byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin bar byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: The maturation of this perfection is that one brings beings to full maturity through the means of attraction, which is to say, through giving, speaking pleasantly, meaningful activity, and consistency between words and deeds.

original: tshe 'di nyid la bde bar gnas pas bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / zhi zhing rab tu zhi la 'dod chags dang bral bas sems can rnams kyi nang na gnod pa med cing rnam par mi 'khrugs pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la bde bar gnas pas bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / zhi zhing rab tu zhi la 'dod chags dang bral bas sems can rnams kyi nang na gnod pa med cing rnam par mi 'khrugs pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: The benefit to oneself is that one benefits oneself through abiding in happiness in this very life. The benefit to others is that one benefits others through being without harm and without disturbance among beings, through being peaceful, very peaceful, and free from attachment.

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu phyi ma la ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i lhar skye bar 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu phyi ma la ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i lhar skye bar 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: The benefit in the future is that one brings forth the result in the future through the purification of wisdom and the accomplishment of the superknowledges, and through being reborn as a pure god.

original: shes rab kyi mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mthu rnam pa bzhi ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of power of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dang ldan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dang ldan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa spong ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses wisdom abandons ignorance, which is the opposite of wisdom.

original: de'i shes rab de bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i shes rab de bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: His wisdom becomes the accumulation for his own enlightenment.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang don mthun pa dang / don spyod pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin pa yin no //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang don mthun pa dang / don spyod pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni tshogs yongs su smin pa yin no //
translated: He brings beings to maturity through the four persuasions: generosity, kind talk, beneficial conduct, and consistency of behavior.üîΩHe benefits himself through the joy and delight that come from discerning the meaning of the things to be known just as they are.

original: shes bya'i dngos po'i don ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen pos bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / thams cad du rigs bar lung 'bogs pas tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la phan pa dang /
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po'i don ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen pos bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / thams cad du rigs bar lung 'bogs pas tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la phan pa dang /
translated: He benefits others through the benefit and happiness in this life and the next that come from teaching the Dharma in a way that is appropriate for each individual.

original: bde bas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bde bas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: He benefits both himself and others through the perfection of the transcendences.

original: phyi ma la des dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sdud par byed pa dang / sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba mngon du byed bar 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma la des dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sdud par byed pa dang / sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba mngon du byed bar 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin te /
translated: The latter is the cause of the result in the future, because it causes the collection of all the roots of virtue and the realization of the freedom from the two obscurations.

original: chos thams cad ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu 'dus la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu 'dus la /
translated: All phenomena are included in the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mthu ni rnam pa bzhi po de dag tu 'dus pas de ni chos kyi mthu yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mthu ni rnam pa bzhi po de dag tu 'dus pas de ni chos kyi mthu yin no //
translated: The power of the six perfections is included in these four aspects, and that is the power of phenomena.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the power of coemergence?

original: rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa dang / sems @212b can rnams kyi don gyi phyir so sor brtags nas sdug bsngal yun ring po rnam pa sna tshogs mi bzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pas mi mdzes pa dang / sems can rnams kyi don kho na'i phyir sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i sdug bsngal bas dga' ba dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa dang / sems @212b can rnams kyi don gyi phyir so sor brtags nas sdug bsngal yun ring po rnam pa sna tshogs mi bzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pas mi mdzes pa dang / sems can rnams kyi don kho na'i phyir sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i sdug bsngal bas dga' ba dang /
translated: It is the natural recollection of past lives, the joy in the suffering that is the accomplishment of the welfare of sentient beings through the examination of the various kinds of unbearable and continuous suffering for the sake of sentient beings, and the joy in the suffering that is the accomplishment of the welfare of sentient beings through the examination of the various kinds of unbearable and continuous suffering for the sake of sentient beings.

original: dga' ldan du skyes nas tshe'i tshad ji srid par dga' ldan na gnas pa dang / dga' ldan du skyes pa'i lha'i bu gzhan dag gnas gsum po lha'i tshe dang / lha'i kha dog dang / lha'i grags pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / dga' ldan nas 'bab pa la sogs pa nas rdo rje'i gdan la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /
analyzed: dga' ldan du skyes nas tshe'i tshad ji srid par dga' ldan na gnas pa dang / dga' ldan du skyes pa'i lha'i bu gzhan dag gnas gsum po lha'i tshe dang / lha'i kha dog dang / lha'i grags pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / dga' ldan nas 'bab pa la sogs pa nas rdo rje'i gdan la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /
translated: From descending from Tushita and so on, he manifestly and perfectly awakens on the vajra seat,üîΩturns the wheel of Dharma, and passes into parinirvana.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi mthu chen po ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba dag ni mngon par shes pas mngon par 'du byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi mthu chen po ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba dag ni mngon par shes pas mngon par 'du byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: These great, wondrous, and marvelous powers are not created by higher perception.

original: rang bzhin gyi mthu yin pas na de'i phyir de dag ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni khams dang sa dang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of the mind that is associated with the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is called ‚Äúultimate.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste ;
translated: The arising of a mind that is signless is as follows:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la dmigs pa mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la dmigs pa mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of a mind that is supramundane and that focuses on cessation.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩsems can dmyal ba pa'i sems skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms kyang glo bur gyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste / sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms kyang glo bur gyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of a mind that is accompanied by suffering is as follows:üîΩThe arising of a mind that is in the hells.

original: tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of a mind that is accompanied by a mixture of feelings is as follows:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni las kyi rnam par smin pa 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni las kyi rnam par smin pa 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of a mind belonging to the desire realm is when there is a mixture of the ripening of karma.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang @214b ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbde ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang @214b ldan pa'i phyir ro // bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of a mind accompanied by joy is when there is the arising of a mind belonging to the first and second meditative absorptions, because it is accompanied by the joy that arises from seclusion and the joy that arises from meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni nang yongs su dang ba las skyes pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni nang yongs su dang ba las skyes pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of a mind accompanied by pleasure is when there is the arising of a mind belonging to the third meditative absorption, because it is accompanied by the pleasure that arises from the purification of internal serenity.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of a mind that is neither painful nor pleasurable is when there is the arising of a mind belonging to the fourth meditative absorption, the formless realm, and the peak of existence, because it is accompanied by equanimity that is free of pain and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i bar gyi sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni skyon brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i bar gyi sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni skyon brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth fault.

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of initial inquiry, investigation, inhalation, exhalation, pleasure, suffering, satisfaction and dissatisfaction.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of the mind associated with defilement is as follows:üîΩThe arising of the mind associated with defilement and secondary defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi sems yod pa'i gnas skabs thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi sems yod pa'i gnas skabs thams cad kyi'o //
translated: This is in all the situations where the defiled mind exists.

original: dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of the mind associated with the wholesome is as follows:

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs thams cad na dge ba bcu gcig gam /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs thams cad na dge ba bcu gcig gam /
translated: The arising of a mind that is accompanied by faith and so on is the arising of a mind that is accompanied by the eleven virtuous mental factors.

original: dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The arising of a mind that is accompanied by the five faculties is the arising of a mind that is accompanied by faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of a mind that is accompanied by indeterminate mental factors is the arising of a mind that is accompanied by the ten universal mental factors.

original: de gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs snga ma gnyis ma gtogs pa rnam par smin pa las skye ba dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang /
analyzed: de gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs snga ma gnyis ma gtogs pa rnam par smin pa las skye ba dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang /
translated: The arising of a mind that is not accompanied by either of those two is the arising of a mind that is accompanied by the mental factors that arise from the ripening of karmic seeds, the mental factors that arise from deportment, the mental factors that arise from skill in arts and crafts, and the mental factors that arise from emanating.üîΩThe arising of a mind that is accompanied by the mental factors that arise from the ripening of karmic seeds is the arising of a mind that is accompanied by the ten universal mental factors and the five specific ones.üîΩThe arising of a mind that is accompanied by the mental factors that arise from deportment is the arising of a mind that is accompanied by the ten universal mental factors and the five specific ones.

original: sprul pa byed pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o //üîΩsems kyi skye ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa dang sems ldog pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa'i sems kyi skye ba'o // sems kyi skye ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa dang sems ldog pa ste /
translated: The arising of a mind that is accompanied by the mental factors that arise from skill in arts and crafts is the arising of a mind that is accompanied by the ten universal mental factors and the five specific ones.üîΩThe arising of a mind that is accompanied by the mental factors that arise from emanating is the arising of a mind that is accompanied by the ten universal mental factors and the five specific ones.üîΩThe arising of a mind is the engagement of mind and the cessation of mind.

original: de dag ni sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug yin no //
translated: These are the sixteen types of arising of mind.

original: ji ltar na gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one skilled in abiding?

original: gal te rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems kyi gnas pa ni gnyis pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems kyi gnas pa ni gnyis pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: If one understands the suchness of cognition just as it is, just as it is, then this is the nature of the second abiding of the mind.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid 'du byed rnams rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du shes pa ni de la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid 'du byed rnams rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du shes pa ni de la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
translated: Thus, the suchness of cognition is the knowledge that formations are mere cognition. This is the skill in that.

original: ji ltar na bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems kyi bslang bar ni gzhan gyi dbang dang / kun brtags pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol zhing yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid du gnas par gyur pa yin pas /üîΩde @215a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems kyi bslang bar ni gzhan gyi dbang dang / kun brtags pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol zhing yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid du gnas par gyur pa yin pas / de @215a * //
translated: How is one skilled in emergence? The emergence of the mind is the attainment of the state of the thoroughly established suchness, which is liberation from the bonds of the dependent and the imagined.

original: ltar shes pa ni de la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: ltar shes pa ni de la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of that is the skill in that.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma'o //
translated: The bonds of signs refers to the signs of the dependent.

original: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The ‚Äúbond of negative reflex actions‚Äù is the imaginary.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes la /
translated: ‚ÄúOne knows them as they really are‚Äù means that one knows the reality of the addictive reality as it is.

original: kun brtags pa ni mtshan nyid med par shes pa'o //üîΩde las sems 'di bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'ching ba de gnyis de ltar shes nas de las rnam par grol bar bya zhing yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin du gnas gyur bar bya ba la mkhas pa ste
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni mtshan nyid med par shes pa'o // de las sems 'di bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'ching ba de gnyis de ltar shes nas de las rnam par grol bar bya zhing yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin du gnas gyur bar bya ba la mkhas pa ste
translated: ‚ÄúOne knows the unreality of the imaginary.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúOne is skilled in the arousing of the mind from that‚Äù means that, having thus known the two bonds, one is skilled in the liberation from them and in the transformation into the perfected reality.üîΩThat is the skill in the arousing of the mind.

original: ; de tsam gyis na sems kyi bslang ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / ji ltar na 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems kyi 'phel ba ni gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas
analyzed: ; de tsam gyis na sems kyi bslang ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / ji ltar na 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems kyi 'phel ba ni gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas
translated: How is one skilled in the increase of the mind? The increase of the mind is the nature of the transformation.

original: de zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi sa skye ba dang 'phel ba shes pa ni de la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: de zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi sa skye ba dang 'phel ba shes pa ni de la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
translated: The knowledge of the arising and increase of that path which is the union of the two is shown to be skill in that.

original: gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin du gnas gyur pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin du gnas gyur pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind which is the antidote is the mind which is the transformation into the perfected.

original: skye ba dang 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi rang gi mtshan nyid skye ba dang rgyun 'phel ba'o //üîΩji ltar na 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems kyi mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems pa yin pas de zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyis 'grib pa dang 'bri bar shes
analyzed: skye ba dang 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi rang gi mtshan nyid skye ba dang rgyun 'phel ba'o // ji ltar na 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems kyi mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems pa yin pas de zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyis 'grib pa dang 'bri bar shes
translated: Arising and increase is the arising and the increase of the continuum of the path which is the union of the two.

original: pa ni de la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: pa ni de la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
translated: How is one skilled in decrease? and so on shows that the knowledge of the decrease and diminution of that mind which is the sign of the mind and the afflicted mind which is the negative reflex action by means of the path which is the union of the two is skill in that.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'phel ba de dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'phel ba de dang ngo //
translated: The antithesis is the increase of that.

original: 'grib cing 'bri ba zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi rang gi mtshan nyid 'grib pa dang rgyun 'bri ba'o //
analyzed: 'grib cing 'bri ba zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi rang gi mtshan nyid 'grib pa dang rgyun 'bri ba'o //
translated: The phrase diminishing and decreasing refers to the diminution and decrease of the essential nature of the path of union.

original: ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar zhus pa'i lan gyi mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar zhus pa'i lan gyi mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: The phrase how is one skilled in means? and so on presents the conclusion to the response that was requested earlier.

original: des ni bshad pas bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag po med pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to /
analyzed: des ni bshad pas bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag po med pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags pa gtan la dbab pa bstan to /
translated: This concludes the presentation of the ascertainment of the designations that was made in order to eliminate the absence of a strong aspiration to cultivate the path and to prevent its loss.

original: // / de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshol ba thams cad 'gog pa shes pa bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag po med pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags paüîΩgtan @215b la dbab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshol ba thams cad 'gog pa shes pa bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag po med pa rnam par gzhig cing chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gdags paüîΩgtan @215b la dbab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to eliminate the absence of a strong aspiration to cultivate the knowledge that puts an end to all forms of investigation in the realm of nirvana that is devoid of the remnants of existence and to prevent its loss, the following is stated as the ascertainment of the designations.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par 'gag go zhes gang gsungs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par 'gag go zhes gang gsungs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: The Blessed One has said, In the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder, all feelings cease without exception.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang 'gag pa'i tshor ba de dag gang lags zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i tshor ba dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang 'gag pa'i tshor ba de dag gang lags zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i tshor ba dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su 'gag pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, what are those feelings that cease?

original: gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba la gnas zhes bya ba ni gnas ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba la gnas zhes bya ba ni gnas ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: The term basis refers to the storehouse consciousness in the situation of the transformation of the basis,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / bag chags thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / bag chags thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of mind, mental factors, and all the propensities.

original: skabs 'dir ni gnas gyur pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs yin pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nyid la gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gnas gyur pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs yin pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nyid la gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, since it is the state of nirvana with remainder of the aggregates, the transformation of the consciousness of the ground of all is called the abode of nonconceptual wisdom itself,

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa dang / stobs bcu la sogs pa'i shes pa thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa dang / stobs bcu la sogs pa'i shes pa thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the abode of all consciousnesses such as the wisdom of equality and the ten powers.

original: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa'i bag chags gnas ngan len dang bcas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa'i bag chags gnas ngan len dang bcas pa la bya ste /
translated: The term negative reflex action refers to the consciousness of the ground of all that is accompanied by the negative reflex actions of the habitual tendencies of affliction at the time of transformation.

original: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba dang / gnas ngan len par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba dang / gnas ngan len par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it makes the body and mind unworkable and creates negative reflex actions.

original: skabs 'dir ni gnas gyur pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs yin pas phung po'i lhag ma tsam yod pa la gnas ngan len ces bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gnas gyur pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs yin pas phung po'i lhag ma tsam yod pa la gnas ngan len ces bya ste /
translated: Here, since it is the state of nirvana with remainder of the aggregates, the mere existence of the remainder of the aggregates is called negative tendencies.

original: tshor ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrig pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba ste gnas ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i tshor ba sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro // rig pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba ste gnas ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i tshor ba sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: Because it is the basis of feeling.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / de la glo bur gyi tshor ba blo bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dag rig pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / de la glo bur gyi tshor ba blo bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dag rig pa'o //
translated: Awareness refers to feeling. In the state of the transformation of the basis, the feeling of foundation consciousness is neither pain nor pleasure, and it is aware of the feelings of pleasure, pain and neither of these that are adventitious to it.

original: skabs 'dir ni gnas gyur pa'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs yin pas gnas gyur pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms la bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gnas gyur pa'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs yin pas gnas gyur pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms la bya ste /
translated: Here, since it is the state of nirvana with remainder of the aggregates, the transformed feeling of equanimity is the awareness.

original: de yang phung po'i lhag ma med @216a * //

translated: In order to liberate the world with its gods,

original: zhes bya ba ni snying rjes sems can la dmigs pa'i sgo nas byang chub tu sems bskyed ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snying rjes sems can la dmigs pa'i sgo nas byang chub tu sems bskyed ba bstan te /
translated: This shows the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment by way of the objective reference of compassion for sentient beings.

original: des ni rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu la brten cing zhes bskul ba bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rten gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu la brten cing zhes bskul ba bstan to //
translated: It shows the exhortation, Relying on the cause of the yoga of the basis.

original: rnal 'byor 'di la rab tu brtson par gyis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di la rab tu brtson par gyis //
translated: This shows the exhortation, Strive at this yoga!

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis la brten nas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid la brtson par gyis shig ces bskul ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis la brten nas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid la brtson par gyis shig ces bskul ba bstan to //
translated: It shows the exhortation, Relying on the two kinds of cause of that kind of yoga, strive at the essence of the path included in the yoga!

original: mdo'i sde'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mdo'i sde'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the verbal definition of the class of SutrasüîΩis shown by the passage beginning with the words,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Maitreya said this to the Lord.

original: de la dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dis zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'i mdo sde 'di'i lus rnam par gzhag pa spyi la snyegs so //
analyzed: de la dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dis zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'i mdo sde 'di'i lus rnam par gzhag pa spyi la snyegs so //
translated: Therein, by this Dharma-paryaya of the Sandhinirmocana refers to the general arrangement of the body of this Sutra which teaches the definitive meaning.
